entry.title: v2ray+wordpress
entry.content: v2ray+wordpressÂèÇËÄÉÂçöÂÆ¢ ÂáÜÂ§áÂ∑•‰ΩúvpsvultrË¥≠‰π∞vpsÔºåÈÄâÊã©New YorkÔºå3.5$/mo„ÄÇ freenomfreenomÁî≥ËØ∑ÂüüÂêçÔºå‰∏çÁî®ÂºÄvpnÔºåEdit Account Details‰∏≠‰øÆÊîπCountry„ÄÅCityÂíåÊâÄÂú®ÂüéÂ∏ÇÂåπÈÖçÂç≥ÂèØ„ÄÇ My Domains -> Manage Domain -> Manage Freenom DNSÔºåÊ∑ªÂä†ÂØπÂ∫îÁöÑAËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÂõæÔºåTarget‰∏≠Â°´ÂÜôË¥≠‰π∞ÁöÑvpsÂú∞ÂùÄ v2rayÈÖçÁΩÆÈÄöËøá‰∏ÄÈîÆÂÆâË£ÖËÑöÊú¨ÔºåËÑöÊú¨github ÊåâÊèêÁ§∫Êìç‰ΩúÂç≥ÂèØÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúv2rayÂÜÖÊ†∏ÁâàÊú¨ËæÉ‰ΩéÔºåÊ≥®ÊÑèÈÄâÊã©ÂÖºÂÆπÊ®°Âºè wordpressÁéØÂ¢ÉÂÆâË£Ö ÂÆâË£ÖlrzszÔºå‰º†Ëæì‰∏§‰∏™Êñá‰ª∂fastcgi.confÂíåfastcgi_paramsÂà∞/etc/nginx/„ÄÇÊñá‰ª∂Âú∞ÂùÄÊòØhttps://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1lAcXkRF_L6c7ywo5YWjFs8JE3ox0bIZd 123sudo apt-get install lrzszcd /etc/nginxrz Ê∑ªÂä†nginxÂØπphpÊîØÊåÅ 1vim /etc/nginx/conf/conf.d/v2ray.conf 1Â§Ñ‰øÆÊîπ‰∏∫ index index.php index.html index.htm 1Â§ÑÂêé2Â§ÑÂâçÔºåÂè¶Ëµ∑‰∏ÄË°åÊ∑ªÂä†Ôºö 12345location ~ \.php$ { fastcgi_pass 127.0.0.1:9000; fastcgi_param SCRIPT_FILENAME $document_root$fastcgi_script_name; include fastcgi_params; } Êõ¥Êñ∞Á≥ªÁªüÁªÑ‰ª∂ 1sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade -y ÂÆâË£Öphp 123456apt install phpapt install php7.4-fpmÊâßË°åÁ¨¨‰∫åÊ≠•Êó∂Â¶ÇÊûúÂá∫Áé∞ubuntuÔºöUnable to locate package phpÔºåÊ∑ªÂä†‰∏Ä‰∏ãÊ∫êÔºösudo apt-add-repository ppa:ondrej/phpsudo apt-get update ÁºñËæëÊñá‰ª∂www.conf 1vim /etc/php/7.4/fpm/pool.d/www.conf Â∞Ülisten = /run/php/php7.4-fpm.sockËØ≠Âè•Ê≥®ÈáäÊéâÔºåÊ∑ªÂä†listen = 127.0.0.1:9000 vimÊêúÁ¥¢Êó∂‰ΩøÁî®ÔºüÊàñËÄÖ /ÔºåÊâæÂà∞ÂêéÂõûËΩ¶ÔºåËøõÂÖ•ÁºñËæëÊ®°ÂºèÂç≥ÂèØ„ÄÇ ÈáçÂêØphpÊúçÂä° 1service php7.4-fpm restart Âà†Èô§ /home/wwwroot/3DCEList/ ÁõÆÂΩï‰∏ãÊâÄÊúâÊñá‰ª∂ 1rm -rf /home/wwwroot/3DCEList/* Âú®‰∏äËø∞Ë∑ØÂæÑ‰∏≠ÂàõÂª∫phpÊµãËØïÊñá‰ª∂ 1vim /home/wwwroot/3DCEList/phpinfo.php Êñá‰ª∂ÂÜÖÂÆπ‰∏∫Ôºö 123<?phpphpinfo();?> ÈáçÂêØnginxÊúçÂä° 1service nginx restart ËæìÂÖ•ÂüüÂêç/phpinfo.phpÊµãËØïphpÔºåÂ¶ÇÂá∫Áé∞‰∏ãÂõæÔºåÂàôphpÂ∑•‰ΩúÊ≠£Â∏∏ ÂÆâË£ÖÊï∞ÊçÆÂ∫ì 1apt install mariadb-server mariadb-client ÂêØÂä®Êï∞ÊçÆÂ∫ì 12systemctl start mariadbsystemctl enable mariadb Êï∞ÊçÆÂ∫ìËÆæÁΩÆÁî®Êà∑ÂêçÂèäÂØÜÁ†Å 1mysql_secure_installation È¶ñÊ¨°ËøõÂÖ•Áõ¥Êé•ÊåâEnterÈîÆ Ôºö ÂÖ∂‰ªñÈÄâÈ°πÈÉΩÊòØy ÈáçÂêØmariadbÊúçÂä° 1systemctl restart mariadb ÂàõÂª∫wordpressÊï∞ÊçÆÂ∫ìÔºåÂπ∂ÂàõÂª∫Áî®Êà∑ÂíåÂØÜÁ†Å 1234mysql -u root -pCREATE DATABASE wordpress_db;CREATE USER 'sh'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'your_passwd'; ÂêëÁî®Êà∑Êéà‰∫àÁâπÊùÉÔºåÂπ∂Âà∑Êñ∞ÈÄÄÂá∫ 1234GRANT ALL ON wordpress_db.* TO 'sh'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'your_passwd';FLUSH PRIVILEGES; #Âà∑Êñ∞exit #ÈÄÄÂá∫ ÂÆâË£ÖphpMyAdmin 12345cd /tmpwget https://files.phpmyadmin.net/phpMyAdmin/4.9.4/phpMyAdmin-4.9.4-all-languages.tar.gztar -xzvf phpMyAdmin-4.9.4-all-languages.tar.gzmv phpMyAdmin-4.9.4-all-languages phpmyadmincp -r phpmyadmin/ /home/wwwroot/3DCEList ÂÆâË£Öwordpress 123456cd /tmp && wget https://cn.wordpress.org/latest-zh_CN.tar.gztar -xvf latest-zh_CN.tar.gzcp -r wordpress/* /home/wwwroot/3DCEList #Â§çÂà∂wordpressÊñá‰ª∂Â§π‰∏ãÁöÑÊñá‰ª∂Âà∞htmlÁõÆÂΩïchown -R www-data:www-data /home/wwwroot/3DCEList #ÊîπÂèòÁî®Êà∑ÂíåÁî®Êà∑ÁªÑchmod -R 755 /home/wwwroot/3DCEList #ÊîπÂèòÁõÆÂΩïÊùÉÈôêmkdir /home/wwwroot/3DCEList/wp-content/uploads #Âª∫Á´ã‰∏ä‰º†Êñá‰ª∂Â§π ËÆæÁΩÆphp‰∏ä‰º†ÂõæÁâáÁöÑÊúÄÂ§ßÂ§ßÂ∞è ÁôªÂΩï‚ÄôÂüüÂêç/phpinfo.php‚ÄòÊü•Áúãphp.iniÁöÑË∑ØÂæÑÊàñ‰ΩøÁî®‰∏ãÈù¢ÁöÑ‰ª£Á†Å 1php -i | grep 'php.ini' ‰øÆÊîπphp.ini 1234567vim /etc/php/7.4/fpm/php.iniupload_max_filesize = 128M #ÊúÄÂ§ß‰∏ä‰º†Â∞∫ÂØ∏post_max_size = 128M #ËØ∑Ê±ÇÊúÄÂ§ßÂ∞∫ÂØ∏memory_limit 256M #phpËøõÁ®ãÂèØ‰ΩøÁî®ÂÜÖÂ≠òÈôêÂà∂max_execution_time 300 #phpÁ®ãÂ∫èÁöÑÊúÄÂ§ßÊâßË°åÊó∂Èó¥max_input_time 300 #ÊúÄÂ§ßËæìÂÖ•Êó∂Èó¥ ËøôÈáåÊàëÈÄöËøá php -i | grep 'php.ini' Êü•ÁúãÂà∞ÁöÑË∑ØÂæÑÂπ∂‰∏çÊòØ‰∏äÈù¢ÁöÑ /etc/php/7.4/fpm/php.iniÔºåËÄåÊòØ /etc/php/7.4/cli/php.ini Ôºå‰ΩÜÊòØ/etc/php/7.4/fpm/php.ini Á°ÆÂÆû‰πüÂ≠òÂú®ÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Êàë‰∏§‰∏™ÈÉΩÊîπ‰∫Ü ÈáçÂêØphpÊúçÂä° 1service php7.4-fpm restart Êõ¥ÊîπnginxÈÖçÁΩÆ‰ΩøËÉΩ‰∏ä‰º†Â§ßÊñá‰ª∂ 1vi /etc/nginx/conf/nginx.conf Âú®http{}‰∏≠Ê∑ªÂä† Ôºöclient_max_body_size 128m; ÈáçÂêØnginxÊúçÂä°Ôºåservice nginx reloadservice nginx reload Ê∑ªÂä†mysqlÊâ©Â±ïÔºåÈáçÂêØÊúçÂä° 12apt -y install php-mysqlservice php7.4-fpm restart ÊúÄÂêéÂú®Âú∞ÂùÄÊ†èËæìÂÖ•ÂüüÂêçÂ∞±ÂèØ‰ª•ÈÖçÁΩÆwordpress‰∫Ü Â¶ÇÊûúÊòæÁ§∫Ôºö‰Ω†ÁöÑPHP‰ºº‰πéÊ≤°ÊúâÂÆâË£ÖËøêË°åWordPressÊâÄÂøÖÈúÄÁöÑMySQLÊâ©Â±ïÔºåÂàô‰ΩøÁî®ÂëΩ‰ª§Ôºö 12apt install php7.4-mysqlservice php7.4-fpm restart wordpressÈÖçÁΩÆÂ°´ÂÜôÂü∫Êú¨‰ø°ÊÅØ ËÆæÁΩÆÁî®Êà∑Âêç„ÄÅÂØÜÁ†ÅÂêéÂç≥ÂèØËøõÂÖ•‰ª™Ë°®Áõò wordpressËøÅÁßªÂÜÖÂÆπËøÅÁßª‰ΩøÁî®Â∑•ÂÖ∑‰∏≠ÁöÑÂØºÂÖ•ÂØºÂá∫ÔºåÂØºÂÖ•‰πãÂâçËøõË°åÊéàÊùÉ 1chmod -R 777 /home/wwwroot ÂØºÂÖ•ÁöÑÊòØÔºöÊâÄÊúâÊñáÁ´†„ÄÅÈ°µÈù¢„ÄÅËØÑËÆ∫„ÄÅËá™ÂÆö‰πâÂ≠óÊÆµ„ÄÅÊù°ÁõÆ‰ø°ÊÅØÔºàÂàÜÁ±ªÂíåÊ†áÁ≠æÁ≠âÔºâ„ÄÅÂØºËà™ËèúÂçï‰ª•ÂèäËá™ÂÆö‰πâÊñáÁ´† ‰∏ªÈ¢òËøÅÁßªÂÆâË£Öashe‰∏ªÈ¢òÔºåÈÄöËøáÂ§ñËßÇ -> About Ashe ‰∏ÄÈîÆÂØºÂÖ•Demo ‰∏ä‰º†ÂõæÁâáÊó∂Â¶ÇÊûúÊèêÁ§∫Ââ™Ë£ÅÂõæÁâáÂèëÁîüÈîôËØØÔºö 12345ÂÆâË£ÖÂåÖÔºösudo apt-get install php7.4-gdÈáçÂêØÊúçÂä°Ôºöservice nginx restartservice php7.4-fpm restart Ê†πÊçÆËÄÅÁΩëÁ´ôÁöÑÈÖçÁΩÆÔºåËøõË°åËá™ÂÆö‰πâ Â∞èÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ËøÅÁßªÂÆâË£ÖÂπ∂ÂêØÁî®Â∞èÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ Widget Importer & ExporterÔºåËøõË°åÂØºÂÖ•ÂØºÂá∫Ôºå‰πãÂêéÂØπÂ§ö‰ΩôÁöÑÂ∞èÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ËøõË°åÂà†Èô§„ÄÅ‰øÆÊîπ

entry.title: PaddleÁõÆÊ†áÊ£ÄÊµã
entry.content: PaddleÁõÆÊ†áÊ£ÄÊµãV1.812paddlepaddle 1.8.3paddlehub 1.8.3 È¢ÑÊµãÊµãËØïÂõæÂÉèÔºö ‰ª£Á†ÅÔºàcalParamsÂèØ‰ª•ËÆ°ÁÆóÂèÇÊï∞ÈáèÔºâÔºö 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344import osimport paddlehub as hubimport numpy as npdef calParams(model): Total_params = 0 Trainable_params = 0 NonTrainable_params = 0 _, _, main_prog = model.context() for block in main_prog.blocks: for var in block.vars: if 'tmp' in var: continue param = block.vars[var] shape = param.shape array = np.asarray(shape) array[array == -1] = 1 mulValue = np.prod(array) Total_params += mulValue if param.persistable and not param.stop_gradient: Trainable_params += mulValue else: NonTrainable_params += mulValue print('Total params: {}'.format(Total_params)) print('Trainable params: {}'.format(Trainable_params)) print('Non-trainable params: {}'.format(NonTrainable_params))def run(img_name): ssd = hub.Module(directory="faster_rcnn_resnet50_fpn_coco2017") path = "./images/" result = ssd.object_detection(paths=[os.path.join(path, img_name)]) print(result[0]['save_path']) return result[0]['save_path']if __name__ == "__main__": # ssd = hub.Module(directory="faster_rcnn_resnet50_fpn_coco2017") # calParams(ssd) run('test_img_cat.jpg') ÁªìÊûúÔºö V2.0.21paddlepaddle-gpu 2.0.2 finetuneÂèÇËÄÉÊñáÊ°£ÔºöÁõÆÊ†áÊ£ÄÊµãÂÖ®ÊµÅÁ®ãÊïôÁ®ã Â¶Ç‰ΩïËÆ≠ÁªÉËá™ÂÆö‰πâÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ Â¶Ç‰ΩïÂáÜÂ§áËÆ≠ÁªÉÊï∞ÊçÆ Ëá™ÂÆö‰πâÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜVOCÊ†ºÂºèÈ¶ñÂÖàÂÆòÁΩëÊñáÊ°£‰∏≠ÁªôÂá∫ÁöÑËØ¥Ê≥ï‰∏ç‰∏ÄÔºåÂú®ÁõÆÊ†áÊ£ÄÊµãÂÖ®ÊµÅÁ®ãÊïôÁ®ã‰∏≠ÔºåÂú®ÂáÜÂ§áÊï∞ÊçÆ‰∏ÄÊ†èÔºåÊåáÂá∫VOCÊ†ºÂºèÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÁöÑÊñá‰ª∂ÁªÑÁªáÁªìÊûÑ‰∏∫Ôºö 12345678910111213‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ annotations‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ road0.xml‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ road1.xml‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ road10.xml‚îÇ | ...‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ images‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ road0.jpg‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ road1.jpg‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ road2.jpg‚îÇ | ...‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ label_list.txt‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ train.txt‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ valid.txt ËÄåÂú®Â¶Ç‰ΩïËÆ≠ÁªÉËá™ÂÆö‰πâÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÂíåÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂáÜÂ§áËÆ≠ÁªÉ‰∏§‰∏™ÊñáÊ°£‰∏≠ÔºåÊåáÂá∫VOCÊ†ºÂºèÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÁöÑÊñá‰ª∂ÁªÑÁªáÁªìÊûÑ‰∏∫Ôºö 12345678910VOCdevkit‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄVOC2007(ÊàñVOC2012)‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Annotations‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ xxx.xml‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ JPEGImages‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ xxx.jpg‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ImageSets‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Main‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ trainval.txt‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test.txt ÈúÄË¶ÅËøõË°åÁöÑÂ§ÑÁêÜ‰∏∫Ôºö ÊÄªÁªìÔºö Ê≤°ÊúâÂøÖË¶Å‰∏ÄÂÆöÊåâÁÖßVOCÂéüÂßãÊ†ºÂºèÁªÑÁªáÊñá‰ª∂ÔºåÂç≥Êñá‰ª∂Â§πÂêçÂ≠ó‰∏çÂøÖÈÅµ‰ªéAnnotaions„ÄÅImageSets„ÄÅJPEGImagesËøôÁßç‰∏•Ê†ºÂëΩÂêçÔºå‰∏îÂéüÊú¨‰øùÂ≠òÂú®ImageSets/Main‰∏ãÁöÑtest.txt„ÄÅtrain.txt„ÄÅval.txtÁ≠âÊñá‰ª∂ÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•‰∏çË¶ÅÔºå‰ΩÜÂú®Êï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÊ†πÁõÆÂΩï‰∏ãÔºàVOC2007ÔºâÂøÖÈ°ªÊúâtrain.txt„ÄÅtest.txtÊñá‰ª∂ Â¶ÇÊûú‰∏•Ê†ºÊåâÁÖßVOCÊ†ºÂºèÔºåÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÊúÄÂ•ΩÊï¥ÁêÜÊàê‰ª•‰∏ãÁªìÊûÑÔºö 12345678910111213VOCdevkit‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄVOC2007(ÊàñVOC2012)‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Annotations‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ xxx.xml‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ JPEGImages‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ xxx.jpg‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ImageSets‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Main‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ trainval.txt‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test.txt‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ train.txt‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ val.txt‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ label_list.txt ÂÖ∂‰∏≠ImageSets/Main‰∏ãÈù¢ÁöÑtrainval.txt„ÄÅtest.txt‰ªÖÂåÖÂê´Êñá‰ª∂ÂêçÔºà‰∏çÂê´ÂêéÁºÄÔºâÔºå‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºö 123c000001c000002... ËÄåÊ†πÁõÆÂΩï‰∏ãÁöÑtrain.txt„ÄÅval.txtÂ∫îÂåÖÂê´ÂõæÁâáÂíåxmlÊñá‰ª∂ÁöÑÁõ∏ÂØπË∑ØÂæÑÔºö 123JPEGImages/train/c000001.jpg Annotations/train/c000001.xmlJPEGImages/train/c000002.jpg Annotations/train/c000002.xml... Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºå‰ª•‰∏äË∑ØÂæÑÂâç‰∏çË¶ÅÂä†‚Äô./‚ÄòÔºåÂç≥‰∏çË¶ÅÂèòÊàê ./JPEGImages/train/c000001.jpgËøôÁßçÂΩ¢Âºè xmlxmlÊñá‰ª∂Â∫îÂ§ÑÁêÜÊàê‰ª•‰∏ãÊ†ºÂºèÔºö 1234567891011121314151617181920212223<annotation> <frame>c000001</frame> <object> <name>holothurian</name> <bndbox> <xmin>712</xmin> <ymin>415</ymin> <xmax>838</xmax> <ymax>573</ymax> </bndbox> <difficult>0</difficult> </object> <object> <name>echinus</name> <bndbox> <xmin>129</xmin> <ymin>940</ymin> <xmax>300</xmax> <ymax>1080</ymax> </bndbox> <difficult>0</difficult> </object></annotation> object‰∏≠Ôºådifficult‰∏∫ÂøÖÂê´È°πÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂéüÊú¨ÁöÑxml‰∏çÂê´difficultÔºåÈÄöËøá‰ª•‰∏ã‰ª£Á†ÅÊ∑ªÂä†Ôºö 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344import xml.etree.ElementTree as ETimport os# ËæìÂá∫‰πãÂâçÈÄöËøáindentÂØπÊ†πËäÇÁÇπËøõË°åÂ§ÑÁêÜÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Ê∑ªÂä†ÂõûËΩ¶ÂíåÁº©ËøõÔºåÂ§ÑÁêÜÊàê‰∏äÈù¢Â±ïÁ§∫ÁöÑxmlÊ†ºÂºèdef indent(elem, level=0): i = "\n" + level * "\t" if len(elem): if not elem.text or not elem.text.strip(): elem.text = i + "\t" if not elem.tail or not elem.tail.strip(): elem.tail = i for elem in elem: indent(elem, level + 1) if not elem.tail or not elem.tail.strip(): elem.tail = i else: if level and (not elem.tail or not elem.tail.strip()): elem.tail = idef cvt(ori_dir, out_dir): for file in os.listdir(ori_dir): tree = ET.parse(os.path.join(ori_dir, file)) root = tree.getroot() newroot = ET.Element('Annotation') filename = ET.SubElement(newroot, 'filename') filename.text = file.split('.')[0] + '.jpg' for i in root.findall('object'): d = ET.SubElement(i, 'difficult') d.text = '0' newroot.append(i) indent(root, 0) tree = ET.ElementTree(root) # root‰∏∫‰øÆÊîπÂêéÁöÑroot tree.write(out_dir+file)if __name__ == '__main__': ori_dir = './train/box/' out_dir = './VOC/temp_Annotations/' cvt(ori_dir, out_dir) ÂÆâË£ÖÁéØÂ¢ÉÂèÇËÄÉÊñáÊ°£ÔºöÂÆâË£ÖËØ¥Êòé ÊåâÁÖßËØ¥ÊòéÂÆâË£ÖÂç≥ÂèØÔºåPaddleDetectionÂøÖÈ°ªË¶ÅÂú®cdÂà∞clone‰∏ãÁöÑÁõÆÂΩïËøêË°åÔºå‰∏çÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™pipÂ∫ì„ÄÇ NCCLÂÆâË£Ö(give up)‰∏ãËΩΩÂú∞ÂùÄÔºönccl Êú¨Âú∞ÂÆâË£ÖÂ∫ì ÈÄâÊã©ÂØπÂ∫îÁöÑÊú¨Âú∞ÂÆâË£ÖÂ∫ìÔºö ‚Äã ÂÆâË£ÖÂÇ®Â≠òÂ∫ìÔºösudo dpkg -i xxxxxxxx.deb ‚Äã Êõ¥Êñ∞aptÂ∫ìÔºösudo apt update ‚Äã ÂÆâË£ÖÔºösudo apt install libnccl2=2.9.6-1+cuda11.0 libnccl-dev=2.9.6-1+cuda11.0 ÁΩëÁªúÂÆâË£ÖÂ∫ì ÂÆâË£ÖÊåáÂçó È¶ñÂÖàÊâßË°åÂëΩ‰ª§ 12sudo apt-key adv --fetch-keys https://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/repos/ubuntu1804/x86_64/7fa2af80.pubsudo add-apt-repository "deb https://developer.download.nvidia.com/compute/cuda/repos/ubuntu1804/x86_64/ /"` ÊèêÁ§∫ No module named ‚Äòapt_pkg‚ÄôÔºåËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºöno module named apt_pkg ÔºåÊâßË°å1Ôºå2Âç≥ÂèØ ‰πãÂêéÊèêÁ§∫ cannot import name ‚Äò_gi‚Äô from ‚Äògi‚ÄôÔºå Ëß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºöcannot import name ‚Äò_gi‚Äô ‰πãÂêéapt updateÊä•ÈîôÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÔºö ËØï‰∫ÜÂá†ÁßçËß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºåÂè™Êúâ‰∏ÄÁßçÊúâÁî®Ôºösolution ÂÆâË£ÖpingÂëΩ‰ª§ÔºåÊé•ÁùÄ ping developer.download.nvidia.com ÂèØ‰ª•ÊâæÂà∞ÂØπÂ∫îÁöÑipÂú∞ÂùÄÔºåÂ∞ÜÂú∞ÂùÄÊ∑ªÂä†Âà∞hostsÊñá‰ª∂‰∏≠Ôºö45.43.38.238 developer.download.nvidia.cn ncll tests123git clone max_iters„ÄÇ max_iters‰∏∫ÊúÄÂ§ßËø≠‰ª£Ê¨°Êï∞ÔºåËÄå‰∏Ä‰∏™iter‰ºöËøêË°åbatch_size * device_numÂº†ÂõæÁâá„ÄÇ Ê≥®ÊÑè:(1) LearningRate.schedulers.milestonesÈúÄË¶ÅÈöèmax_itersÂèòÂåñËÄåÂèòÂåñ„ÄÇ (2) milestonesËÆæÁΩÆÁöÑÊòØÂú®PiecewiseDecayÂ≠¶‰π†ÁéáË∞ÉÊï¥Á≠ñÁï•‰∏≠ÔºåÂú®ËÆ≠ÁªÉËΩÆÊï∞ËææÂà∞milestones‰∏≠ËÆæÁΩÆÁöÑËΩÆÊï∞Êó∂ÔºåÂ≠¶‰π†Áéá‰ª•gammaÂÄçÊï∞Ë°∞ÂáèÂèòÂåñ„ÄÇ(3) 1xË°®Á§∫ËÆ≠ÁªÉ12‰∏™epochÔºå1‰∏™epochÊòØÂ∞ÜÊâÄÊúâËÆ≠ÁªÉÊï∞ÊçÆËÆ≠ÁªÉ‰∏ÄËΩÆ„ÄÇÁî±‰∫éYOLOÁ≥ªÂàóÁÆóÊ≥ïÊî∂ÊïõÊØîËæÉÊÖ¢ÔºåÂú®COCOÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ‰∏äYOLOÁ≥ªÂàóÁÆóÊ≥ïÊç¢ÁÆóÂêéÁ∫¶‰∏∫270 epochÔºåPP-YOLOÁ∫¶380 epoch„ÄÇ Ê†πÊçÆÂÆûÈôÖÊÉÖÂÜµ‰øÆÊîπmax_itersÔºåÂπ∂ÂèÇÁÖßÂ¶Ç‰ΩïËÆ≠ÁªÉËá™ÂÆö‰πâÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ‰∏ãÁöÑdemoÔºå‰øÆÊîπÂÖ∂‰ªñÂèÇÊï∞ÔºåÂ¶Çmilestones„ÄÅbase_lr Ê†πÊçÆÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÊ†ºÂºè‰øÆÊîπmerticÔºåËøôÈáå‰øÆÊîπ‰∏∫VOC snapshot_iterÔºåÂ§öÂ∞ëiter‰øùÂ≠ò‰∏ÄÊ¨°Ê®°Âûã weightsÂèÇÊï∞Ôºå weights ÂèÇÊï∞Áî®‰∫éËÆæÁΩÆËØÑ‰º∞È¢ÑÊµã‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑÊ®°ÂûãË∑ØÂæÑÔºåËøôÈáåÂèØ‰ª•ÊòØËøúÁ®ãË∑ØÂæÑ„ÄÇÊú¨Âú∞Ë∑ØÂæÑÊòØÊåá‰ª•pdparams‰∏∫ÂêéÁºÄÁöÑÊ®°ÂûãÊùÉÈáçÊñá‰ª∂„ÄÇ output/underwaterÔºåÂú®Ê≠§Ë∑ØÂæÑ‰∏ãÊúâ‰ª•‰∏ãÂá†‰∏™Êñá‰ª∂Ôºömodel_final.pdmodel„ÄÅmodel_final.pdopt(‰ºòÂåñÁõ∏ÂÖ≥)„ÄÅmodel_final.pdparams(Ê®°ÂûãÊùÉÈáç)ÔºåÂàôweightsÂøÖÈ°ªËÆæÁΩÆ‰∏∫Ôºöoutput/underwater/model_final norm_type: bn norm_decay: 0. depth: 50 feature_maps: [2, 3, 4, 5] freeze_at: 2FPN: min_level: 2 max_level: 6 num_chan: 256 spatial_scale: [0.03125, 0.0625, 0.125, 0.25]FPNRPNHead: anchor_generator: rpn_batch_size_per_im: 256 rpn_fg_fraction: 0.5 rpn_positive_overlap: 0.7 rpn_negative_overlap: 0.3 rpn_straddle_thresh: 0.0 train_proposal: min_size: 0.0 nms_thresh: 0.7 pre_nms_top_n: 2000 keep_top_k: 100 nms_threshold: 0.5 score_threshold: 0.05TwoFCHead: mlp_dim: 1024LearningRate: base_lr: 0.02 schedulers: - !PiecewiseDecay gamma: 0.1 milestones: [60000, 80000] - !LinearWarmup configs/yolov3_mobilenet_v1_roadsign.yml -o use_gpu=true save_prediction_only=true È¢ÑÊµãÔºö 1python3 tools/infer.py -c configs/underwater.yml -o weights=output/underwater/model_final --infer_img=../underwater/dataset/test-A-image/000001.jpg È¢ÑÊµãÂêé‰ºöÂú®outputÊñá‰ª∂Â§π‰∏ãÁîüÊàê‰∏ÄÂº†ÂõæÁâá GPU+infer_dir: 1CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=3 python3 tools/infer.py -c configs/underwater.yml -o weights=output/underwater/best_model use_gpu=true --infer_dir=../underwater/dataset/test-A-image/ Ê∫êÁ†Å‰øÆÊîπ PaddleDetection/ppdet/utils/coco_eval.py 123Á¨¨342Ë°åÔºåcoco_res‰∏≠Ê∑ªÂä†[xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax]Ê†ºÂºèÁöÑbox:'xxyy_bbox': [xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax] PaddleDetection/tools/infer.py 1234567891011121314151617Á¨¨42Ë°åÔºåÂºïÁî®clip_bboxÂáΩÊï∞from ppdet.utils.coco_eval import clip_bboxÁ¨¨227Ë°åÔºåÊ∑ªÂä†ËæìÂá∫csvÁöÑ‰ª£Á†ÅÔºöimport pandas as pd# print(image_path)# print(bbox_results)df = pd.DataFrame(columns=('name', 'image_id', 'confidence', 'xmin', 'ymin', 'xmax', 'ymax'))df_image_id = str(image_path.split('/')[-1].split('.')[0])for i in bbox_results: df_temp_name = catid2name[i['category_id']] # Ê≥®ÊÑèh,wÊòØÂèçËøáÊù•ÁöÑ xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax = clip_bbox(i['xxyy_bbox'],[image.size[1], image.size[0]]) df.loc[len(df)] = [df_temp_name, df_image_id, i['score'], int(xmin), int(ymin), int(xmax), int(ymax)] df.to_csv('/home/paddle2.0/PaddleDetection/output/result.csv', mode='a', header=False, index = False)

entry.title: PaddleÂõæÂÉèÂàÜÁ±ª
entry.content:
PaddleÂõæÂÉèÂàÜÁ±ªV1.812paddlepaddle 1.8.3paddlehub 1.8.3 È¢ÑÊµã123456789101112131415import paddlehub as hubimport osdef run(img_name): classifier = hub.Module(directory="vgg19_imagenet") path = './images/' input_dict = {"image": [os.path.join(path, img_name)]} result = classifier.classification(data=input_dict) print(result) return resultif __name__ == "__main__": run('test_img_cat.jpg') ËøîÂõûÁªìÊûúÔºö[[{'tiger cat': 0.5675306916236877}]] finetuneÂÆòÊñπÊñáÊ°£Ôºögithub Ëá™ÂÆö‰πâÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ123456‚îú‚îÄdata: Êï∞ÊçÆÁõÆÂΩï ‚îú‚îÄtrain_list.txtÔºöËÆ≠ÁªÉÈõÜÊï∞ÊçÆÂàóË°® ‚îú‚îÄtest_list.txtÔºöÊµãËØïÈõÜÊï∞ÊçÆÂàóË°® ‚îú‚îÄvalidate_list.txtÔºöÈ™åËØÅÈõÜÊï∞ÊçÆÂàóË°® ‚îú‚îÄlabel_list.txtÔºöÊ†áÁ≠æÂàóË°® ‚îî‚îÄ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ ËÆ≠ÁªÉ/È™åËØÅ/ÊµãËØïÈõÜÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÂàóË°®Êñá‰ª∂ÁöÑÊ†ºÂºèÂ¶Ç‰∏ã 123ÂõæÁâá1Ë∑ØÂæÑ ÂõæÁâá1Ê†áÁ≠æÂõæÁâá2Ë∑ØÂæÑ ÂõæÁâá2Ê†áÁ≠æ... label_list.txtÁöÑÊ†ºÂºèÂ¶Ç‰∏ã 123ÂàÜÁ±ª1ÂêçÁß∞ÂàÜÁ±ª2ÂêçÁß∞... ‰ª•fruitsÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ‰∏∫‰æãÔºåÊï∞ÊçÆÂàóË°®Êñá‰ª∂‰∏∫Ôºö 123JPEGImages/apple_21.jpg 0JPEGImages/apple_22.jpg 0... ÁõÆÂΩïÁªìÊûÑ‰∏∫Ôºö 1234567‚îú‚îÄDataset: Êï∞ÊçÆÁõÆÂΩï ‚îú‚îÄJPEGImagesÔºöÂÇ®Â≠òÂõæÁâá ‚îú‚îÄtrain_list.txtÔºöËÆ≠ÁªÉÈõÜÊï∞ÊçÆÂàóË°® ‚îú‚îÄtest_list.txtÔºöÊµãËØïÈõÜÊï∞ÊçÆÂàóË°® ‚îú‚îÄvalidate_list.txtÔºöÈ™åËØÅÈõÜÊï∞ÊçÆÂàóË°® ‚îú‚îÄlabel_list.txtÔºöÊ†áÁ≠æÂàóË°® ‚îî‚îÄ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ ‰ª£Á†Å1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253545556575859606162636465666768697071727374757677787980818283848586878889# coding:utf-8import osimport paddle.fluid as fluidimport paddlehub as hubimport numpy as npimport datetimefrom paddlehub.dataset.base_cv_dataset import BaseCVDataset# os.environ["CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES"] = "9"# os.environ['FLAGS_eager_delete_tensor_gb'] = '0.0'class SelfDataset(BaseCVDataset): def __init__(self, dataset): base_path = '/..../Datasets/' + dataset super(SelfDataset, self).__init__( base_path=base_path, train_list_file="train_list.txt", validate_list_file="validate_list.txt", test_list_file="test_list.txt", label_list_file="label_list.txt", label_list=None)def finetune(module_name, dataset_name, checkpoint_name, use_selfdataset=False, use_gpu=True, num_epoch=10, batch_size=16, use_data_parallel=True): # Load Paddlehub pretrained model module = hub.Module(name=module_name) input_dict, output_dict, program = module.context(trainable=True) # Load dataset if use_selfdataset: try: dataset = SelfDataset(dataset_name) except ValueError: print("%s dataset can't be loaded" % dataset_name) else: if dataset_name.lower() == "flowers": dataset = hub.dataset.Flowers() elif dataset_name.lower() == "dogcat": dataset = hub.dataset.DogCat() elif dataset_name.lower() == "indoor67": dataset = hub.dataset.Indoor67() elif dataset_name.lower() == "food101": dataset = hub.dataset.Food101() else: raise ValueError("%s dataset is not defined" % dataset_name) # Use ImageClassificationReader to read dataset data_reader = hub.reader.ImageClassificationReader( image_width=module.get_expected_image_width(), image_height=module.get_expected_image_height(), images_mean=module.get_pretrained_images_mean(), images_std=module.get_pretrained_images_std(), dataset=dataset) feature_map = output_dict["feature_map"] # Setup feed list for data feeder feed_list = [input_dict["image"].name] checkpoint_dir = os.path.join('./finetune_ckpt/', checkpoint_name) if not os.path.exists(checkpoint_dir): os.makedirs(checkpoint_dir) # Setup RunConfig for PaddleHub Fine-tune API config = hub.RunConfig( use_data_parallel=use_data_parallel, use_cuda=use_gpu, num_epoch=num_epoch, batch_size=batch_size, checkpoint_dir=checkpoint_dir, strategy=hub.finetune.strategy.DefaultFinetuneStrategy()) # Define a image classification task by PaddleHub Fine-tune API task = hub.ImageClassifierTask( data_reader=data_reader, feed_list=feed_list, feature=feature_map, num_classes=dataset.num_labels, config=config) # Fine-tune by PaddleHub's API task.finetune_and_eval()if __name__ == "__main__": finetune('vgg19_imagenet', 'indoor67', 'vgg_indoor_test_gpu', use_selfdataset=False, num_epoch=10, batch_size = 128, use_gpu=True) Êé•Âè£1def finetune(module_name, dataset_name, checkpoint_name, use_selfdataset=False, use_gpu=True, num_epoch=10, batch_size=16, use_data_parallel=True): module_nameÔºöÁõÆÂâçÂåÖÊã¨Âõõ‰∏™ÂõæÂÉèÂàÜÁ±ªÊ®°ÂûãÔºöefficientnetb7_imagenet„ÄÅresnext50_vd_64x4d_imagenet„ÄÅvgg19_imagenet„ÄÅxception71_imagenet dataset_nameÔºöpaddleËá™Â∏¶Êï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÂåÖÊã¨Ôºöflowers„ÄÅdogcat„ÄÅindoor67„ÄÅfood101. Â¶ÇÊûúÊòØÁî®Êà∑Ëá™ÂÆö‰πâÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÔºådataset_name‰∏∫DatasetsÁõÆÂΩï‰∏ãÁî®Êà∑Ëá™ÂÆö‰πâÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÂêç„ÄÇ checkpoint_nameÔºöÊ®°ÂûãÂíåcacheÊñá‰ª∂‰øùÂ≠ò‰ΩçÁΩÆÔºåÈªòËÆ§Âú® finetune_ckptÁõÆÂΩï‰∏ã„ÄÇÂëΩÂêçÊó∂‰∏çË¶ÅÈáçÂ§ç„ÄÇ use_selfdatasetÔºöÂΩì‰ΩøÁî®Áî®Êà∑Ëá™ÂÆö‰πâÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÊó∂ËÆæÁΩÆ‰∏∫True ‰øùÂ≠òloss‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂú®ËøêË°åËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠ËæìÂá∫lossÂà∞txtÊñá‰ª∂ÔºåÂØπpaddlehub/finetune/task/base_task.pyËøõË°å‰øÆÊîπ ‰øÆÊîπÈÉ®ÂàÜÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÔºö 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627BaseTaskÁ±ªÔºö__init__ÂáΩÊï∞‰∏≠ÔºåÊ∑ªÂä†‰ª•‰∏ã‰ª£Á†Å#### BEGIN #### ÔºàÁ∫¶313Ë°åÔºåself.device_countÂÆö‰πâ‰πãÂêéÔºâself.cachefilepath = os.path.join(self.config.checkpoint_dir, 'cache.txt')##### END #####_default_eval_end_eventÂáΩÊï∞‰∏≠ÔºåÊ∑ªÂä†‰ª•‰∏ã‰ª£Á†Å#### BEGIN #### ÔºàÁ∫¶822Ë°åÔºålogger.eval‰πãÂêéÔºâwith open(self.cachefilepath, "a") as file: file.write("[%s dataset evaluation result] loss=%.5f %s[step/sec: %.2f]
" % (self.phase, eval_loss, log_scores, run_speed))##### END ######### BEGIN #### ÔºàÁ∫¶845Ë°åÔºålogger.eval‰πãÂêéÔºâwith open(self.cachefilepath, "a") as file: file.write("best model saved to %s [best %s=%.5f]
" % (model_saved_dir, main_metric, main_value))##### END #####_default_log_interval_eventÂáΩÊï∞‰∏≠ÔºåÊ∑ªÂä†‰ª•‰∏ã‰ª£Á†Å#### BEGIN #### ÔºàÁ∫¶875Ë°åÔºålogger.train‰πãÂêéÔºâwith open(self.cachefilepath, "a") as file: file.write("step %d / %d: loss=%.5f %s[step/sec: %.2f]
" % (self.current_step, self.max_train_steps, avg_loss, log_scores, run_speed))##### END ##### Ë¢´Ë∞ÉÁî®Âú®_runÂáΩÊï∞‰∏≠ÔºåÁ∫¶1247Ë°åÔºåÈÉ®ÂàÜ‰ª£Á†ÅÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÔºö 1234567891011if self.is_train_phase: if self.current_step % self.config.log_interval == 0: self._log_interval_event(period_run_states) global_run_states += period_run_states period_run_states = [] if self.config.save_ckpt_interval and self.current_step % self.config.save_ckpt_interval == 0: self._save_ckpt_interval_event() if do_eval and self.current_step % self.config.eval_interval == 0: self._eval_interval_event()

entry.title: dockerÊìç‰Ωú
entry.content: ÊûÑÂª∫ÈïúÂÉècommit Êñ∞Âª∫ÂÆπÂô® Âú®ÂÆπÂô®ÂÜÖÂÆâË£ÖÊâÄÈúÄÁöÑÁéØÂ¢É ÈÄöËøácommitÂëΩ‰ª§Âª∫Á´ãÊñ∞ÁöÑimage docker commit container_id image_name:tag Dockerfile Â∞ÜÈ°πÁõÆ‰ª£Á†ÅÊã∑Ë¥ùÂà∞‰∏ªÊú∫Êüê‰∏ÄË∑ØÂæÑ‰∏ãÔºàÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøádocker cpÔºåÂπ∂‰øùËØÅË∑ØÂæÑ‰∏ãÊ≤°ÊúâÂÖ∂‰ªñÊñá‰ª∂Ôºâ Âú®Âêå‰∏ÄË∑ØÂæÑ‰∏ãÂàõÂª∫DockerfileÊñá‰ª∂ 1234FROM fasttext:1.0ADD ./docker_file /home/FasttextWORKDIR /home/FasttextCMD ["python3", "/home/Fasttext/api.py"] ADD‰ºöÂ∞Ü‰∏ªÊú∫ÁöÑÊåáÂÆöË∑ØÂæÑÊñá‰ª∂Êã∑Ë¥ùÂà∞Êñ∞Âª∫ÂÆπÂô®ÁöÑÂØπÂ∫îË∑ØÂæÑ‰∏ã CMD‰ºöÂú®docker runÊó∂ËøêË°å ÈÄöËøábuildÂàõÂª∫ÈïúÂÉè docker build -t fasttext:2.0 . Ê≥®ÊÑèÊúÄÂêéÊúâ‰∏™‰∏ä‰∏ãÊñáË∑ØÂæÑÔºåÂÖ∑‰ΩìÂèØËßÅÔºödockerfile ÂàõÂª∫ÂÆπÂô®‰∫§‰∫íÊñπÂºè1nvidia-docker run -itd --name Fasttext_test -v /host_dir:/container_dir -p host_port:container_port container_id /bin/bash ÂêéÂè∞ËøêË°åÊñπÂºè1nvidia-docker run -d -p host_port:container_port container_id dockerhub Ê≥®ÂÜåÂπ∂Âª∫Á´ãÂÖ¨ÂÖ±‰ªìÂ∫ì Êú¨Âú∞‰ΩøÁî® docker login ËøõË°åÁôªÂΩï tag‰øÆÊîπÈïúÂÉèÂêçÁß∞Ôºödocker tag container_name your_dockerhub_id/your_dockerhub_repository docker push your_dockerhub_id/your_dockerhub_repository ÂØπ‰∫éÂêå‰∏Ä‰∏™‰ªìÂ∫ìÔºåÂëΩ‰ª§ÊòØÂõ∫ÂÆöÁöÑ docker logout ÈÄÄÂá∫ ÈïúÂÉèÊâìÂåÖ1docker save -o fasttext.tar fasttext:2.0

entry.title: Êú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†Â§ç‰π†
entry.content: ‰∏Ä„ÄÅÊú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†‰ªãÁªç&Á∫øÊÄß„ÄÅÈÄªËæëÂõûÂΩí‰ªÄ‰πàÊòØÊú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π† Ë¶ÅÂ≠¶‰ªÄ‰πà‚ÄîÂÜ≥Á≠ñÂáΩÊï∞ ‰ªéÂì™ÈáåÂ≠¶‚ÄîËÆ≠ÁªÉÊï∞ÊçÆ ÊÄéÊ†∑Â≠¶‰π†‚ÄîÊ±ÇËß£Êú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†Ê®°Âûã ÈíàÂØπÊüê‰∏™‰ªªÂä° ÔºàTask ÔºâÔºåÂà©Áî®ËÆ≠ÁªÉÊï∞ÊçÆ ÔºàExperience ÔºâÔºåÊ±ÇËß£‰∏Ä‰∏™Â≠¶‰π†Ê®°ÂûãÔºå‰ªéËÄåÊèêÈ´òËØ•‰ªªÂä°ÁöÑÊÄßËÉΩ ÔºàPerformanceÔºâ Êú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†Ë¶ÅÁ¥†Ôºö ‰ªªÂä°„ÄÅÁõÆÊ†áÔºàTaskÔºâ ‰ΩøÁî®ÁªèÈ™åÊï∞ÊçÆÔºàExperienceÔºâ ÊèêÈ´òÂ≠¶‰π†ÊÄßËÉΩÔºàPerformanceÔºâ Á∫øÊÄß„ÄÅÈÄªËæëÂõûÂΩíÂ§öÂÖÉÁ∫øÊÄßÂõûÂΩí ÊçüÂ§±ÂáΩÊï∞Âá†‰ΩïÊÑè‰πâÔºöËØïÂõæÊâæÂà∞‰∏Ä‰∏™Ë∂ÖÂπ≥Èù¢Ôºå‰ΩøÊâÄÊúâÊ†∑Êú¨Âà∞Ë∂ÖÂπ≥Èù¢‰∏äÁöÑÊ¨ßÂºèË∑ùÁ¶ª‰πãÂíåÊúÄÂ∞è Ê¢ØÂ∫¶‰∏ãÈôçÊ≥ïÊ±ÇËß£ ÈöèÊú∫Ê¢ØÂ∫¶‰∏ãÈôçÊ≥ï Ê≠£ËßÑÊñπÁ®ã ÊØîËæÉ MSE Ôºàmean square errorÔºâ ÂùáÊñπËØØÂ∑Æ F1 measure ÈÄªËæëÂõûÂΩí Ê¢ØÂ∫¶‰∏äÂçáÊ≥ïÊ±ÇËß£Ôºö ‰∫å„ÄÅÁ•ûÁªèÁΩëÁªú ÊçüÂ§±‰∫åÂàÜÁ±ªÊçüÂ§± Â§öÂàÜÁ±ªÊçüÂ§± ÂõûÂΩíÊçüÂ§± ÂèçÂêë‰º†Êí≠‰∏ÄËà¨ÊÉÖÂΩ¢ Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºåÁî±‰∫é$z^l$ÊòØÂÖ≥‰∫él-1Â±ÇÊùÉÈáçÂíåÂÅèÁΩÆÁöÑÂáΩÊï∞ÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÂØπ$b^{l-1}$ Ê±ÇÂÅèÂØºÔºåÈìæÂºèÊ≥ïÂàôÂâçÈù¢Â∫îËØ•ÊòØÂØπlÂ±ÇÁöÑzÊ±ÇÂÅèÂØº„ÄÇ Á•ûÁªèÁΩëÁªúÊ®°ÂûãÁÆóÊ≥ï ÂØπÊï∞‰ººÁÑ∂vs‰∫åÊ¨°‰ª£‰ª∑ ‰∫åÊ¨°‰ª£‰ª∑ÔºöÂàöÂºÄÂßãÂ≠¶‰π†ÁöÑÈÄüÂ∫¶ÊØîËæÉÁºìÊÖ¢ ‰∫§ÂèâÁÜµÔºöÂàöÂºÄÂßãÂ≠¶‰π†ÁöÑÈÄüÂ∫¶Áõ∏ÂΩìÂø´Ôºå‰∏éÊúüÂæÖ‰∏ÄÊ†∑ÔºåÂΩì‰∏•ÈáçÈîôËØØÊó∂ËÉΩ‰ª•ÊúÄÂø´ÈÄüÂ∫¶Â≠¶‰π†ÔºõÂΩìÈ¢ÑÊµãËæìÂá∫Êé•ËøëÊ≠£Á°ÆËæìÂá∫Êó∂ÔºåÂ≠¶‰π†ÈÄüÂ∫¶ÂèòÊÖ¢ ‰∏â„ÄÅÊîØÊåÅÂêëÈáèÊú∫ÈóÆÈ¢òÂª∫Ê®° Ê±ÇËß£Á∫¶Êùü‰ºòÂåñ„ÄÅÂØπÂÅ∂ SVMÂØπÂÅ∂ÈóÆÈ¢ò ÂØπÂÅ∂ÈóÆÈ¢òÁöÑËßÑÊ®°Ê≠£ÊØî‰∫éËÆ≠ÁªÉÊ†∑Êú¨Êï∞ ‰æãÂ≠ê Ë∂ÖÂπ≥Èù¢Ê≥ïÂêëÈáèÊòØÊîØÊåÅÂêëÈáèÁöÑÁ∫øÊÄßÁªÑÂêàÔºö‰ªÖÊîØÊåÅÂêëÈáèÁöÑ $\alpha_i \neq0$ SVMÊÄßË¥® ËΩØSVM Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºåËΩØSVM‰∏ªÈóÆÈ¢ò‰∏≠ÁöÑÁ∫¶ÊùüÂ§ö‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™ $\epsilon_i \geq 0$ ËΩØSVMÂØπÂÅ∂ÈóÆÈ¢òÊé®ÂØº ËΩØSVMÈ´òÊïàÊ±ÇËß£ Âõõ„ÄÅÈõÜÊàêÂ≠¶‰π†„ÄÅÁâπÂæÅÈÄâÊã©ÈõÜÊàêÂ≠¶‰π†ÈõÜÊàêÊñπÊ≥ïÂàÜÁ±ª ‰∏≤Ë°åÂºèÈõÜÊàêÂ≠¶‰π† Ôºö‰∏™‰ΩìÂ≠¶‰π†Âô®‰πãÈó¥Â≠òÂú®Âº∫‰æùËµñÂÖ≥Á≥ªÔºåÂêéÁîüÊàêÁöÑ‰∏™‰ΩìÂ≠¶‰π†Âô®‰æùËµñÂâçÈù¢ÁîüÊàêÁöÑ‰∏™‰ΩìÂ≠¶‰π†Âô®„ÄÇ‰ª£Ë°®ÊÄßÁÆóÊ≥ï Boosting„ÄÇ Âπ∂Ë°åÂºèÈõÜÊàêÂ≠¶‰π†ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºö ‰∏™‰ΩìÂ≠¶‰π†Âô®‰πãÈó¥‰∏çÂ≠òÂú®Âº∫‰æùËµñÂÖ≥Á≥ªÔºå‰ª£Ë°®ÊòØ BaggingÂíåÈöèÊú∫Ê£ÆÊûó ÈáçÈááÊ†∑ÊñπÊ≥ï ÈöèÊú∫ÈááÊ†∑ÔºöÂú®ÂéüÊù•ÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ‰∏äÈöèÊú∫ÈááÊ†∑‰∏Ä‰∏™Â≠êÈõÜÔºåÂæóÂà∞Êñ∞ÁöÑËÆ≠ÁªÉÈõÜÔºåËøôÂ∞±ÊòØ Bagging ÊóèÊñπÊ≥ïÁöÑÂÅöÊ≥ï„ÄÇ Â∏¶ÊùÉÈááÊ†∑ÔºöÈááÊ†∑Êó∂ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÁªôËÆ≠ÁªÉÈõÜÈáåÁöÑÊØè‰∏™ÂÖÉÁ¥†‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÊùÉÔºåÊùÉÂÄºÈÄöËøá‰∏ä‰∏ÄÊ¨°ËÆ≠ÁªÉÁöÑÁªìÊûúÊù•Á°ÆÂÆö„ÄÇËøôÂ∞±ÊòØBoosting ÊóèÊñπÊ≥ïÁöÑÂÅöÊ≥ï„ÄÇ AdaBoostÂÖ≥Ê≥® Ë¢´ÈîôÂàÜÁöÑÊ†∑Êú¨ Âô®Èáç ÊÄßËÉΩÂ•ΩÁöÑÂº±ÂàÜÁ±ªÂô® Bagging ÈöèÊú∫Ê£ÆÊûó ÁâπÂæÅÈÄâÊã©‰∏éÁ®ÄÁñèÂ≠¶‰π†ËøáÊª§ÂºèÊñπÊ≥ï ÂçïÂèòÈáèËøáÊª§ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºöSingal-to-noise ratio (S2N) Relief ÂåÖË£πÂºèÊñπÊ≥ï ÂµåÂÖ•ÂºèÊñπÊ≥ï LassoÂõûÂΩí ÂùêÊ†á‰∏ãÈôçÊ≥ïÊ±ÇËß£ ÂùêÊ†á‰∏ãÈôçÊ≥ïÊé®ÂØº Áªº‰∏äÊúâÔºö ÊÄªÁªì Á®ÄÁñèÂ≠¶‰π† xi‰∏∫p*1Áª¥ÔºåB‰∏∫p*kÁª¥Ôºåai‰∏∫k*1Áª¥Ôºå‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØÂ∞ÜÊ†∑Êú¨x‰ªépÁª¥ÈôçÂà∞kÁª¥ ‰∫î„ÄÅÈùûÁõëÁù£Â≠¶‰π†Ê¶ÇËø∞„ÄÅË¥ùÂè∂ÊñØÂàÜÁ±ªÂô®ËÅöÁ±ªÁÆóÊ≥ï Â±ÇÊ¨°ËÅöÁ±ªÁÆóÊ≥ïÔºöËá™Â∫ïËÄå‰∏äÔºöËÅöÂêàÔºõËá™È°∂ËÄå‰∏ãÔºöÂàÜË£Ç ÂàíÂàÜÂºèËÅöÁ±ªÁÆóÊ≥ïÔºöÁªôÂá∫ÈöèÊú∫ÂåñÂàùÂßãÂàíÂàÜÔºõÂØπÂàíÂàÜËø≠‰ª£‰ºòÂåñÔºöKmeans„ÄÅGMM K-means ÁÆóÊ≥ïÂ§çÊùÇÂ∫¶ ËÅöÁ±ª‰∏≠ÂøÉÂàùÂÄºÈÄâÊã©Ôºö ÈÄöËøáÂêØÂèëÂºèÊñπÊ≥ïÈÄâÊã©Â•ΩÁöÑÂàùÂÄºÔºö‰æãÂ¶ÇË¶ÅÊ±ÇÁßçÂ≠êÁÇπ‰πãÈó¥ÊúâËæÉÂ§ßÁöÑË∑ùÁ¶ª Â∞ùËØïÂ§ö‰∏™ÂàùÂÄº ÔºåÈÄâÊã©Âπ≥ÊñπËØØÂ∑ÆÂíåÊúÄÂ∞èÁöÑ‰∏ÄÁªÑËÅöÁ±ªÁªìÊûú Ë¥ùÂè∂ÊñØÂàÜÁ±ªÂô® Âà§Âà´ÂºèÊ®°ÂûãÔºöÈÄöËøáÂØπ ùëÉ(ùëê|ùë•)Áõ¥Êé•Âª∫Ê®°È¢ÑÊµãÔºåÁõ¥Êé•ÂØπÊù°‰ª∂Ê¶ÇÁéáÂª∫Ê®°Ôºå‰∏çÂÖ≥ÂøÉËÉåÂêéÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÂàÜÂ∏É ùëÉ(ùë•,ùëê) ÁîüÊàêÂºèÊ®°ÂûãÔºöÊ¶ÇÁéáÂàÜÂ∏ÉÂª∫Ê®° Êú¥Á¥†Ë¥ùÂè∂ÊñØÂàÜÁ±ªÂô® ÈÅøÂÖç0Ê¶ÇÁéáÈóÆÈ¢ò Êú¥Á¥†ÂøÖË¶ÅÊÄß È´òÊñØÊú¥Á¥†Ë¥ùÂè∂ÊñØÂàÜÁ±ªÂô®È´òÊñØÂàÜÂ∏É ËøôÈáåÂÖ¨ÂºèÈáåÁöÑpÊòØÁª¥Â∫¶ÔºåÂç≥pÁª¥È´òÊñØ È´òÊñØÊú¥Á¥†Ë¥ùÂè∂ÊñØ Êú¥Á¥†È´òÊñØÂøÖË¶ÅÊÄß È´òÊñØË¥ùÂè∂ÊñØÂÜ≥Á≠ñÈù¢ Á∫øÊÄßÂà§Âà´ÂàÜÊûêÔºàLDAÔºâ LDAÊòØÂÅáËÆæÂçèÊñπÂ∑ÆÁü©ÈòµÁõ∏ÂêåÔºåÊú¥Á¥†È´òÊñØÂíåÈùûÊú¥Á¥†È´òÊñØÁöÑÂå∫Âà´Âú®‰∫éÂçèÊñπÂ∑ÆÁü©ÈòµÊòØÂê¶‰∏∫ÂØπËßíÈòµ LDA vs ÈÄªËæëÂõûÂΩí È´òÊñØÊú¥Á¥†Ë¥ùÂè∂ÊñØÂÜ≥Á≠ñÈù¢ ÊÄªÁªì Êú¥Á¥†Ë¥ùÂè∂ÊñØÂèØ‰ª•Â§ÑÁêÜÁ¶ªÊï£Â±ûÊÄßÂíåÂèØ‰ª•Â§ÑÁêÜËøûÁª≠Â±ûÊÄß KNN ÂÖ≠„ÄÅGMM„ÄÅEMGMM EMÁÆóÊ≥ïÊ±ÇËß£ Áº∫ÁÇπ ÊÄªÁªì ‰∏É„ÄÅÈ©¨Â∞îÂèØÂ§´ÈìæË¥ùÂè∂ÊñØÁΩë È©¨Â∞îÂèØÂ§´Èìæ ‰∏âË¶ÅÁ¥† Áä∂ÊÄÅËΩ¨Áßª ÂÖ´„ÄÅPCAhttp://blog.codinglabs.org/articles/pca-tutorial.html https://croook.github.io/2020/04/08/%E7%BA%BF%E6%80%A7%E4%BB%A3%E6%95%B0%E3%80%81%E6%A6%82%E7%8E%87%E8%AE%BA/ SVD ÊñπÊ≥ï Ê¶ÇÁéáPCA PCA EMÁÆóÊ≥ï Ê†∏PCA LLE t-SNE

entry.title: tfidf-ldadaÊñáÊú¨ÂàÜÁ±ª
entry.content: Tfidf‰∏∫‰∫ÜÁªüËÆ°ËØçÈ¢ëÔºåÂ∞ÜÂàÜËØçÂêéÁöÑÂ≠óÁ¨¶‰∏≤ÂàÜÂâ≤ÊàêËØç 12X_train = [[word for word in line.split()] for line in X_train]X_test = [[word for word in line.split()] for line in X_test] 12345678910111213def tfidf(X_train): # print(X_train[:3]) dict = corpora.Dictionary(X_train) # dict.save('dict1.dict') corpus = [dict.doc2bow(text) for text in X_train] # print(corpus[:3]) tfidf_model = models.TfidfModel(corpus) # num_docs=100805, num_nnz=1761406 # test = ['ÂèçÊò†', 'xx', ... , 'xx', 'ÈóÆÈ¢ò'] # print(dict.doc2bow(test)) # print(tfidf_model[dict.doc2bow(test)]) corpus_tfidf = tfidf_model[corpus] # corpus_tfidf.save('corpus_tfidf.corp') return corpus_tfidf, tfidf_model, dict # ÂèåÂ±Çlist corpursÊòØÂ∞ÜËØçËΩ¨Âåñ‰∏∫Ôºàid, ËØçÈ¢ëÔºâÁöÑÂΩ¢Âºè corpus_tfidfÊòØÔºàidÔºåtfidfÊùÉÈáçÔºâÁöÑÂΩ¢Âºè ÈÄöËøátfidf_model[anycoupus]ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Â∞Ü‰ªªÊÑèÁöÑÁªèËøádict.doc2bowËΩ¨Êç¢ÂêéÁöÑËØçÈ¢ëcorpusËΩ¨Âåñ‰∏∫tfidf corpusÔºåËøôÈáåÁöÑcorpus_tfidf = tfidf_model[corpus]Ôºå Âè™ÊòØËΩ¨Âåñ‰∫ÜËá™Ë∫´„ÄÇ LDAldaÁî®Âú®ÊñáÊú¨ÂàÜÁ±ª‰∏≠Êú¨Ë¥®ÊòØÈôçÁª¥ÔºåldaÊúâÂ§öÂ∞ë‰∏™‰∏ªÈ¢òÔºåÂ∞±ÂèØ‰ª•Â∞Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™Âè•Â≠êÊò†Â∞ÑÂà∞Â§öÂ∞ëÁª¥ÔºåË°®Á§∫Â±û‰∫éÊØè‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∏ªÈ¢òÁöÑÂèØËÉΩÊÄßÔºåÂÜçÂ∞ÜËøô‰∏™embedding‰ΩøÁî®ÂàÜÁ±ªÂô®ËøõË°åÂàÜÁ±ª„ÄÇ 1lda = models.ldamulticore.LdaMulticore(corpus=corpus_tfidf, id2word=dict, num_topics=100) ‰πãÂêéÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøá lda.inference([tfidf_model[dict.doc2bow(i)]])[0][0] ÂæóÂà∞‰∏Ä‰∏™Êñ∞ÁöÑËØçÁªÑÁöÑembedding 123456789train, test = [], []for i in X_train: train.append(lda.inference([tfidf_model[dict.doc2bow(i)]])[0][0])for i in X_test: test.append(lda.inference([tfidf_model[dict.doc2bow(i)]])[0][0])train, test = np.asarray(train), np.asarray(test)np.save('train.npy', train)np.save('test.npy', test) ÂàÜÁ±ª1234567train, test = np.load('train.npy').tolist(), np.load('test.npy').tolist()print("------Training svm classifier------")sv = SVC(C=1, kernel='rbf')sv.fit(train, y_train)pred_y = sv.predict(test)print(classification_report(y_test, pred_y))

entry.title: fasttextÊñáÊú¨ÂàÜÁ±ª
entry.content: fastText1InstallÂ¶ÇÊûúÁõ¥Êé•Áî® pip install fasttext‰ºöÊä•‰∏ÄÂ†ÜÈîôËØØÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Áî®‰ª•‰∏ãÊñπÊ≥ïÂÆâË£ÖÔºö 123$ git clone https://github.com/facebookresearch/fastText.git$ cd fastText$ pip install . ËøôÊ†∑ÂÆâË£ÖÂêé‰ºöÂá∫Áé∞Âú®powershell‰∏≠ÂèØ‰ª•import fasttextÔºå‰ΩÜÂú®Anaconda Prompt‰∏≠ÊàñËÄÖpycharm‰∏≠Êó†Ê≥ïimportÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇÊä•ÈîôÔºöImportError:DLL load failed Ëß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ°àÊòØconda‰∏≠activate Âè¶‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁéØÂ¢ÉÔºåpip install fasttextÔºåËøôÊó∂‰ºöÂèëÁé∞base‰∏≠Â∑≤ÁªèÂÆâË£ÖÂ•Ω‰∫ÜÔºå‰∏çÁî®ÈáçÊñ∞‰∏ãËΩΩÔºåÁõ¥Êé•ÂÆâË£ÖÔºåÂèëÁé∞ÊòØÂèØ‰ª•ÁöÑ„ÄÇ ‰πãÂêéÂõûÂà∞baseÔºåpip uninstall fasttext, ÂÜçÈáçÊñ∞ pip install fasttext Ê†πÊçÆÊñ∞ÁéØÂ¢É‰∏≠Â∑≤ÁªèÂÆâË£ÖÂ•ΩÁöÑÂåÖÔºåÈáçÊñ∞ÂÆâË£Ö„ÄÇ fastText2fastText model123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627class Model(nn.Module): def __init__(self, config): super(Model, self).__init__() if config.embedding_pretrained is not None: self.embedding = nn.Embedding.from_pretrained(config.embedding_pretrained, freeze=False) else: self.embedding = nn.Embedding(config.n_vocab, config.embed, padding_idx=config.n_vocab - 1) self.embedding_ngram2 = nn.Embedding(config.n_gram_vocab, config.embed) self.embedding_ngram3 = nn.Embedding(config.n_gram_vocab, config.embed) self.dropout = nn.Dropout(config.dropout) self.fc1 = nn.Linear(config.embed * 3, config.hidden_size) # self.dropout2 = nn.Dropout(config.dropout) self.fc2 = nn.Linear(config.hidden_size, config.num_classes) def forward(self, x): out_word = self.embedding(x[0]) out_bigram = self.embedding_ngram2(x[2]) out_trigram = self.embedding_ngram3(x[3]) out = torch.cat((out_word, out_bigram, out_trigram), -1) out = out.mean(dim=1) out = self.dropout(out) out = self.fc1(out) out = F.relu(out) out = self.fc2(out) return out nn.EmbeddingÔºå ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂÅö‰∏Ä‰∏™Â≠óÂÖ∏ÔºåÂ≠óÂÖ∏‰∏≠ÊØè‰∏™Á¥¢ÂºïÂØπÂ∫î‰∏Ä‰∏™ËØçÂíåËØçÁöÑembeddingÂΩ¢Âºè„ÄÇÂà©Áî®Ëøô‰∏™Ê®°ÂùóÔºåÂèØ‰ª•ÁªôËØçÂÅöembeddingÁöÑÂàùÂßãÂåñÊìç‰Ωú„ÄÇ padding_idx Â¶ÇÊûúÁªôÂÆöÔºåÂàôÈÅáÂà∞padding_idx‰∏≠ÁöÑÁ¥¢ÂºïÔºåÂàôÂ∞ÜÂÖ∂‰ΩçÁΩÆÂ°´0Ôºà0ÊòØÈªòËÆ§ÂÄºÔºâ„ÄÇ ÂÖ∂‰∏≠ config.n_gram_vocab‰ºöÂú®ËøêË°åËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠ËµãÂÄºÔºåconfig.n_vocab = len(vocab)Ôºåconfig.n_gram_vocab = 250499 Ê®°ÂûãËæìÂÖ•Ôºö [batch_size, seq_len] embeddingÂ±ÇÔºöÈöèÊú∫ÂàùÂßãÂåñ, ËØçÂêëÈáèÁª¥Â∫¶‰∏∫embed_sizeÔºå2-gramÂíå3-gramÂêåÁêÜÔºöwordÔºö [batch_size, seq_len, embed_size]2-gramÔºö[batch_size, seq_len, embed_size]3-gramÔºö[batch_size, seq_len, embed_size] ÊãºÊé•embeddingÂ±ÇÔºö[batch_size, seq_len, embed_size * 3] Ê±ÇÊâÄÊúâseq_len‰∏™ËØçÁöÑÂùáÂÄº[batch_size, embed_size * 3] ÂÖ®ËøûÊé•+ÈùûÁ∫øÊÄßÊøÄÊ¥ªÔºöÈöêÂ±ÇÂ§ßÂ∞èhidden_size[batch_size, hidden_size] ÂÖ®ËøûÊé•+softmaxÂΩí‰∏ÄÂåñÔºö[batch_size, num_class]==>[batch_size, 1] build_dataset1234567891011build_dataset if ues_word: tokenizer = lambda x: x.split(' ') # ‰ª•Á©∫Ê†ºÈöîÂºÄÔºåword-level else: tokenizer = lambda x: [y for y in x] # char-level if os.path.exists(config.vocab_path): vocab = pkl.load(open(config.vocab_path, 'rb')) else: vocab = build_vocab(config.train_path, tokenizer=tokenizer, max_size=MAX_VOCAB_SIZE, min_freq=1) pkl.dump(vocab, open(config.vocab_path, 'wb')) print(f"Vocab size: {len(vocab)}") Â¶ÇÊûúË∑ØÂæÑÊúâËØçË°®ÔºåÁõ¥Êé•Âä†ËΩΩÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊ≤°ÊúâÂàôÁîüÊàêËØçË°®„ÄÇ 12345678910111213141516def build_vocab(file_path, tokenizer, max_size, min_freq): vocab_dic = {} with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='UTF-8') as f: for line in tqdm(f): lin = line.strip() if not lin: continue content = lin.split('\t')[0] for word in tokenizer(content): vocab_dic[word] = vocab_dic.get(word, 0) + 1 # ÊåâÁÖßÂ≠ó/ËØçÈ¢ëÈôçÂ∫èÊéíÂàó [(' ', 80926), ('0', 60319), ('1', 40420)] vocab_list = sorted([_ for _ in vocab_dic.items() if _[1] >= min_freq], key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)[:max_size] # Ê†πÊçÆ‰∏äÈù¢ÁöÑËØçÈ¢ëÈôçÂ∫èÂàóË°®ÂçáÂ∫èÂÆö‰πâid {' ': 0, '0': 1, '1': 2} vocab_dic = {word_count[0]: idx for idx, word_count in enumerate(vocab_list)} vocab_dic.update({UNK: len(vocab_dic), PAD: len(vocab_dic) + 1}) return vocab_dic ÁîüÊàêÁöÑËØçË°®ÊåâÁÖßËØçÈ¢ëÈôçÂ∫èÊéíÂàóÔºå‰ªé0ÂºÄÂßãËµãÂÄºÔºåegÔºö{‚ÄòÂ∏ÇÊ∞ë‚Äô: 0, ‚ÄòÂèçÊò†‚Äô: 1, ‚ÄòÈóÆÈ¢ò‚Äô: 2, ‚ÄòÊù•Áîµ‚Äô: 3, ‚ÄòÂ∏åÊúõ‚Äô: 4} ÊúÄÂêéÊ∑ªÂä† UNK, PAD = ‚Äò\‚Äò, ‚Äò\‚ÄòÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•‰πãÂâçfastTextÂÆö‰πâEmbeddingÊó∂Ôºå‰ºöÊúâÔºöself.embedding = nn.Embedding(config.n_vocab, config.embed, padding_idx=config.n_vocab - 1)Ôºåpadding_idx=config.n_vocab - 1Ë°®Á§∫ÂΩìÈÅáÂà∞\Êó∂ÔºåÁî®0Â°´ÂÖÖembedding„ÄÇ 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849build_dataset def biGramHash(sequence, t, buckets): t1 = sequence[t - 1] if t - 1 >= 0 else 0 return (t1 * 14918087) % buckets def triGramHash(sequence, t, buckets): t1 = sequence[t - 1] if t - 1 >= 0 else 0 t2 = sequence[t - 2] if t - 2 >= 0 else 0 return (t2 * 14918087 * 18408749 + t1 * 14918087) % buckets def load_dataset(path, pad_size=32): contents = [] with open(path, 'r', encoding='UTF-8') as f: for line in tqdm(f): lin = line.strip() if not lin: continue content, label = lin.split('\t') label = label.replace('"', "") words_line = [] token = tokenizer(content) seq_len = len(token) if pad_size: if len(token) < pad_size: token.extend([PAD] * (pad_size - len(token))) else: token = token[:pad_size] seq_len = pad_size # word to id for word in token: words_line.append(vocab.get(word, vocab.get(UNK))) # fasttext ngram buckets = config.n_gram_vocab bigram = [] trigram = [] # ------ngram------ for i in range(pad_size): bigram.append(biGramHash(words_line, i, buckets)) trigram.append(triGramHash(words_line, i, buckets)) # ----------------- contents.append((words_line, int(label), seq_len, bigram, trigram)) return contents # [([...], 0), ([...], 1), ...] train = load_dataset(config.train_path, config.pad_size) dev = load_dataset(config.dev_path, config.pad_size) test = load_dataset(config.test_path, config.pad_size) return vocab, train, dev, test load_dataset: È¶ñÂÖàÂØπ‰∫éÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÁöÑÊØè‰∏ÄË°åÊìç‰ΩúÔºåÊ†πÊçÆ‚Äô\t‚ÄôÂàÜÂâ≤contentÂíåÊ†áÁ≠æÔºålabel = label.replace('"', "")ÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫Êüê‰∫õÂàÜÂâ≤ÂêéÁöÑÊ†áÁ≠æÂêé‰ºöÂá∫Áé∞‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂºïÂè∑ÔºåÂéüÂõ†Ëøò‰∏çÊòéÁôΩ„ÄÇ‰πãÂêéÊ†πÊçÆpad_sizeÂ∞ëË°•Â§öÊà™Ôºåseq_lenË°®Á§∫ÂÜÖÂÆπÁöÑËØçÊï∞ÔºàÂ¶ÇÊûúË∂ÖËøápad_sizeÂàô‰∏∫pad_sizeÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂ∞è‰∫éÂàô‰∏∫ÂÆûÈôÖÈïøÂ∫¶Ôºâ words_lineÂÇ®Â≠òËØ•Âè•ÊâÄÊúâÂçïËØçÁöÑÁºñÂè∑ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊâæ‰∏çÂà∞Âàô‰∏∫UNK„ÄÇ 14918087Ëøô‰∫õÊï∞Â≠óÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØÁî®Âá†‰∏™Ë¥®Êï∞ÂÅöÁöÑÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑÂìàÂ∏åÂáΩÊï∞ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•‰øÆÊîπÔºåÁõÆÁöÑÂ∞±ÊòØÊääÊâÄÊúân-gramÈÉΩÊò†Â∞ÑÂà∞‰∏Ä‰∏™ËØçË°®‰∏≠„ÄÇ ÊúÄÂêéËÆ≠ÁªÉÊó∂ÈÄöËøá words_lineÔºåbigramÔºåtrigramÊâæÂà∞ÂØπÂ∫îÂú®ËØçË°®embedding„ÄÅ2gram embedding„ÄÅ3gram embedding‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰ΩçÁΩÆÔºåËøõË°åÂπ≥Âùá DatasetIterater1iter = DatasetIterater(dataset, config.batch_size, config.device) 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354class DatasetIterater(object): def __init__(self, batches, batch_size, device): self.batch_size = batch_size self.batches = batches self.n_batches = len(batches) // batch_size self.residue = False # ËÆ∞ÂΩïbatchÊï∞ÈáèÊòØÂê¶‰∏∫Êï¥Êï∞ if len(batches) % self.n_batches != 0: self.residue = True self.index = 0 self.device = device def _to_tensor(self, datas): # xx = [xxx[2] for xxx in datas] # indexx = np.argsort(xx)[::-1] # datas = np.array(datas)[indexx] x = torch.LongTensor([_[0] for _ in datas]).to(self.device) y = torch.LongTensor([_[1] for _ in datas]).to(self.device) bigram = torch.LongTensor([_[3] for _ in datas]).to(self.device) trigram = torch.LongTensor([_[4] for _ in datas]).to(self.device) # padÂâçÁöÑÈïøÂ∫¶(Ë∂ÖËøápad_sizeÁöÑËÆæ‰∏∫pad_size) seq_len = torch.LongTensor([_[2] for _ in datas]).to(self.device) return (x, seq_len, bigram, trigram), y """ ÂØπÂ∫îÁöÑÊòØtrain‰∏≠Ôºå for i, (trains, labels) in enumerate(train_iter): outputs = model(trains) """ def __next__(self): # Â¶ÇÊûúÊòØÊúÄÂêé‰∏Ä‰∏™batch‰∏îÈïøÂ∫¶‰∏çË∂≥batch_size if self.residue and self.index == self.n_batches: batches = self.batches[self.index * self.batch_size: len(self.batches)] self.index += 1 batches = self._to_tensor(batches) return batches elif self.index >= self.n_batches: self.index = 0 raise StopIteration else: batches = self.batches[self.index * self.batch_size: (self.index + 1) * self.batch_size] self.index += 1 batches = self._to_tensor(batches) return batches def __iter__(self): return self def __len__(self): if self.residue: return self.n_batches + 1 else: return self.n_batches

entry.title: image-caption-papers_202004_Oscar
entry.content: Oscar: Object-Semantics Aligned Pre-training for Vision-Language TasksOscar: Object-Semantics Aligned Pre-training The code and pre-trained models are released: https://github.com/microsoft/Oscar We pre-train an Oscar model on the public corpus of 6.5 million text-image pairs, and fi ne-tune it on downstream tasks, creating new state-of-the-arts on six well-established vision-language understanding and generation tasks. Introduction OscarÊ®°Âûã‰ΩøÁî®ÁõÆÊ†áÊ£ÄÊµãÂæóÂà∞ÁöÑobject tags‰Ωú‰∏∫anchor pointsÊù•Â∏ÆÂä©ËøõË°åimage-textÁöÑËØ≠‰πâÂØπÈΩê„ÄÇËæìÂÖ•‰∏∫‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∏âÂÖÉÁªÑÔºåÂåÖÂê´a word sequence, a set of object tags, and a set of image region featuresÔºåË°®Á§∫‰∏∫$(w,q,v)$„ÄÇ È¢ÑËÆ≠ÁªÉÂæóÂà∞ÁöÑÊ®°ÂûãÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøáfine tuneÂ∫îÁî®‰∫é‰∏ãÊ∏∏ÁöÑË∑®Ê®°ÊÄÅ‰ªªÂä°ÔºåÂåÖÊã¨ 5 understanding tesks„ÄÅ2 generation tesks„ÄÇ Ê®°ÂûãÂú®6.5M Image‚Äã-text pairs‰∏äËøõË°å‰∫ÜÈ¢ÑËÆ≠ÁªÉÔºåËØ≠ÊñôÂ∫ìÊù•Ëá™‰∫éÁé∞ÊúâÁöÑV+LÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÔºåÂåÖÊã¨COCO„ÄÅCC„ÄÅSBUcaptions„ÄÅflickr30k„ÄÅGQAÁ≠â contribution We introduce Oscar, a powerful VLP method to learn generic image-text representations for V+L understanding and generation tasks. We have developed an Oscar model that achieves new SoTA on multiple V+L benchmarks, outperforming existing approaches by a signi cant margin We present extensive experiments and analysis to provide insights on the effectiveness of using objecttags as anchor points for cross-modal representation learning and downstream tasks. BackgrounddatasetÔºö$D={(I_i,w_i)}^{N}_{i=1}$ ÔºåThe goal of pre-training is to learn cross-modal representations of image-text pairs in a self-supervised manner Existing VLP methods take visual region features $v={v_1,¬∑¬∑¬∑,v_K}$ of an image and word embeddings $w={w_1,¬∑¬∑¬∑,w_T}$ of its paired text as input, and relies on the self-attention mechanism to learn image-text alignments and produce cross-modal contextual representations. Áé∞ÊúâÁöÑVLPÊñπÊ≥ïÂ≠òÂú®‰∏§‰∏™ÈóÆÈ¢òÔºö Ambiguity. Áî±‰∫éÂõæÂÉè‰ΩçÁΩÆÁöÑÈáçÂè†ÔºåÂØºËá¥ÊèêÂèñÁöÑvisual embeddingsÊúâÊ≠ß‰πâÔºåÂ¶Ç‰∏äÂõæ(a)‰∏≠ÁöÑdogÂíåcouch„ÄÇ Lack of grounding. VLPÊòØÂº±ÁõëÁù£Â≠¶‰π†ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÂõæÂÉèÂå∫ÂüüÂíåÊñáÊú¨ÂçïËØç‰πãÈó¥Âπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâÊòéÁ°ÆÁöÑÂØπÈΩêÊñπÂºè„ÄÇ‰ΩÜ‰∏ÄËà¨ÂõæÂÉè‰∏≠ÁöÑÊòæËëóÁõÆÊ†á‰ºöÂêåÊó∂Âá∫Áé∞Âú®imageÂíåÂØπÂ∫îÁöÑtext‰∏≠ÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§ÂèØÁî®‰Ωúanchor pointsÊù•Â∏ÆÂä©ÂØπÈΩê„ÄÇ ‰ªé‰∏äÂõæ(c) ‰∏≠ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂá∫ÔºådogÂíåcouchÁî±‰∫éÂú®ÂõæÂÉè‰∏≠ÈáçÂè†Èù¢ÁßØËæÉÂ§ßÔºåÂú®Region Feature‰∏≠Ë∑ùÁ¶ªËæÉËøëÔºå‰∏çÂ•ΩÂå∫ÂàÜ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÂú®Word Embedding‰∏≠Ë∑ùÁ¶ªËæÉËøúÔºåÊõ¥Â•ΩÂå∫ÂàÜ„ÄÇ Oscar Pre-training InputËæìÂÖ•‰∏∫Word-Tag-Image‰∏âÂÖÉÁªÑÔºåË°®Á§∫‰∏∫$(w,q,v)$Ôºå$w$ ÊòØÊñáÊú¨Â∫èÂàóÁöÑembeddingÔºå$q$ ÊòØË¢´Ê£ÄÊµãÁâ©‰ΩìÊñáÊú¨Ë°®Á§∫ÁöÑembeddingÔºå$v$ ÊòØregion vectorÁöÑÈõÜÂêà„ÄÇ Áé∞ÊúâÁöÑVLPÊñπÊ≥ï‰∏ÄËà¨Â∞Ü$(w,v)$ ‰Ωú‰∏∫ËæìÂÖ•ÔºåOscar‰∏∫‰∫Ü‰æø‰∫éÂõæÊñáÂØπÈΩêÔºåÂºïÂÖ•‰∫Ü$q$ ‰Ωú‰∏∫anchor points. $v$ Âíå$q$ ÁöÑ‰∫ßÁîüËøáÁ®ãÂ¶Ç‰∏ã„ÄÇÂØπ‰∫éÊúâK‰∏™ÁõÆÊ†áÁöÑÂõæÂÉèÔºåÁî®Faster R-CNNÊèêÂèñÊØè‰∏™Âå∫ÂüüÁöÑËßÜËßâËØ≠‰πâ$(v^{‚Äò},z)$ Ôºå$v^{‚Äò}$ ÊòØregion featureÔºå‰∏∫P (2048) Áª¥ÂêëÈáèÔºå$z$ ‰∏∫region positionÔºå‰∏∫R (4 or 6) Áª¥ÂêëÈáèÔºåÈÄöËøáÂ∞ÜÂÖ∂ÊãºÊé•ÔºåÂæóÂà∞‰ΩçÁΩÆÊïèÊÑüÁöÑÂå∫ÂüüÁâπÂæÅÂêëÈáèÔºåÂ∞ÜÂÖ∂ÈÄöËøáÁ∫øÊÄßÊäïÂΩ±ËΩ¨Âåñ‰∏∫ $v$Ôºå‰ªéËÄå‰ΩøÂÖ∂Âíåword embeddingÁöÑÁª¥Â∫¶‰øùÊåÅ‰∏ÄËá¥„ÄÇ$q$ ‰∏∫Ë¢´Ê£ÄÊµãÁõÆÊ†áÁöÑÊñáÊú¨embedding„ÄÇ Pre-Training Objective A Dictionary View: Masked Token Loss$x^{‚Äò}$ ÊòØdictionary viewÔºå‰ªéËøô‰∏™ËßíÂ∫¶Ôºå$w„ÄÅq$ Âùá‰∏∫word embeddingË°®Á§∫Ôºåshare the same linguistic semantic sapceÔºõwhile $v$ lie in the visual semantic space. We defi ne the discrete token sequence as $h\triangleq [w,q]$, and apply the Masked Token Loss (MTL) for pre-training. At each iteration, we randomly mask each input token in $h$ with probability 15%, and replace the masked one $h_i$ with a special token $[MASK]$. The goal of training is to predict these masked tokens based on their surrounding tokens $h_{\backslash i}$ and all image features $v$ by minimizing the negative log-likelihood: A Modality View: Contrastive LossFor each input triple, we group $h^{‚Äò}\triangleq [q,v]$ to represent the image modality, and consider $w$ as the language modality. We then sample a set of ‚Äúpolluted‚Äù image representations by replacing $q$ with probability 50% with a different tag sequence randomly sampled from the dataset $D$. Since the encoder output on the special token $[CLS]$ is the fused vision-language representation of $(h^{‚Äò},w)$ , we apply a fully-connected (FC) layer on the top of it as a binary classi er $f(.)$ to predict whether the pair contains the original image representation (y = 1) or any polluted ones (y = 0). The contrastive loss is de ned as The full pre-training objective of Oscar is: Implementation Details‰ΩúËÄÖËÆ≠ÁªÉ‰∫Ü‰∏§ÁßçÊ®°ÂûãÔºö$Oscar_B$ and $Oscar_L$ ÔºåÂàÜÂà´Áî®BERT base (H=768)ÂíåBERT large (H=1024)ÂàùÂßãÂåñÂèÇÊï∞ÔºåË°®Á§∫‰∏∫$\theta_{BERT}$„ÄÇÂêåÊó∂Ôºå‰∏∫‰∫Ü‰øùËØÅÂõæÂÉèÂå∫ÂüüÁâπÂæÅÂíå BERTÊúâÂêåÊ†∑ÁöÑ input embedding sizeÔºåÂ∞Ü‰∏äËø∞ÊèêÂà∞ÁöÑposition-sensitive region features ËøõË°ålinear projectionÔºåÈÄöËøáÁü©Èòµ $W$ ÂÆûÁé∞„ÄÇ Âõ†Ê≠§ÂèØËÆ≠ÁªÉÁöÑÂèÇÊï∞ÂèØË°®Á§∫‰∏∫ $\theta={\theta_{BERT},W}$„ÄÇ Adapting to Image CaptioningThe input samples are processed to triples consisting of image region features, captions, and object tags, in the same way as that during the pre-training. We randomly mask out 15% of the caption tokens and use the corresponding output representations to perform classi cation to predict the token ids. Similar to VLP, the self-attention mask is constrained such that a caption token can only attend to the tokens before its position to simulate a uni-directional generation process. Note that all caption tokens will have full attentions to image regions and object tags but not the other way around. During inference, we first encode the image regions, object tags, and a special token $[CLS]$ as input. Then the model starts the generation by feeding in a $[MASK]$ token and sampling a token from the vocabulary based on the likelihood output. Next, the $[MASK]$ token in the previous input sequence is replaced with the sampled token and a new $[MASK]$ is appended for the next word prediction. The generation process terminates when the model outputs the $[STOP]$ token. We use beam search (i.e., beam size = 5) in our experiments and report our results on the COCO image captioning dataset. Results‰∏∫‰∫ÜËÄÉËôëÂèÇÊï∞ÁöÑÂà©Áî®ÊïàÁéáÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Âú®‰∏ãË°® 1 ‰∏≠ÊØîËæÉ‰∫Ü‰∏çÂêåÂ§ßÂ∞èÁöÑÊ®°Âûã„ÄÇOscar Âú®ÂÖ≠È°π‰ªªÂä°‰∏äÂùáËææÂà∞‰∫ÜÊúÄÊñ∞Ê∞¥Âπ≥„ÄÇÂú®Â§ßÂ§öÊï∞‰ªªÂä°‰∏äÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÂü∫Êú¨Ê¨æÊ®°ÂûãÔºàbase modelÔºâË¶Å‰ºò‰∫é‰ª•ÂâçÁöÑÂ§ßÂûãÊ®°ÂûãÔºàlarge modelÔºâÔºåÈÄöÂ∏∏ÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ã‰ºöÂ§ßÂ§ßÊèêÈ´ò„ÄÇ ÂÆÉË°®Êòé Oscar ÂÖ∑ÊúâÂæàÈ´òÁöÑÂèÇÊï∞Âà©Áî®ÊïàÁéáÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ËÆ§‰∏∫ÈÉ®ÂàÜÂéüÂõ†ÊòØÁâ©‰ΩìÁöÑ‰ΩøÁî®Â§ßÂ§ßÁÆÄÂåñ‰∫ÜÂõæÂÉèÂíåÊñáÊú¨‰πãÈó¥ËØ≠‰πâÂØπÈΩêÁöÑÂ≠¶‰π†„ÄÇ Êàë‰ª¨‰ΩøÁî® t-SNE ÂèØËßÜÂåñÂ∑•ÂÖ∑ÔºåÊää COCO ÊµãËØïÈõÜÁöÑÂõæÂÉè-ÊñáÊú¨ÂØπÁöÑËØ≠‰πâÁâπÂæÅÁ©∫Èó¥ÁîªÂú®‰∫Ü‰∫åÁª¥Âπ≥Èù¢‰∏ä„ÄÇÂØπ‰∫éÊØè‰∏™ÂõæÂÉèÂå∫ÂüüÂíåÂçïËØçÂ∫èÂàóÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÂÖ∂‰º†ÈÄíÈÄöËøáÊ®°ÂûãÔºåÂπ∂Â∞ÜÂÖ∂ÊúÄÂêé‰∏ÄÂ±ÇËæìÂá∫Áî®‰ΩúÁâπÂæÅ„ÄÇÊØîËæÉÂ∏¶ÊúâÂíå‰∏çÂ∏¶ÊúâÁâ©‰ΩìÊ†áÁ≠æÁöÑÈ¢ÑËÆ≠ÁªÉÊ®°Âûã„ÄÇ Âõæ 4 ‰∏≠ÁöÑÁªìÊûúÊè≠Á§∫‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∫õÊúâË∂£ÁöÑÂèëÁé∞„ÄÇÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂèëÁé∞ÊòØÂÖ≥‰∫éÂêå‰∏Ä‰∏™Áâ©‰ΩìÁöÑ‰∏§Áßç‰∏çÂêåÊ®°ÊÄÅÁöÑÔºöÂÄüÂä©ÂØπË±°Ê†áÁ≠æÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Â§ßÂ§ßÂáèÂ∞ë‰∏§‰∏™Ê®°ÊÄÅ‰πãÈó¥Âêå‰∏ÄÂØπË±°ÁöÑË∑ùÁ¶ª„ÄÇ ‰æãÂ¶ÇÔºåOscar ‰∏≠ Person ÁöÑÂõæÁâáÂíåÊñáÊú¨Ë°®Á§∫ÊØîÂü∫Á∫øÊñπÊ≥ï‰∏≠ÁöÑËßÜËßâË°®Á§∫ÂíåÊñáÊú¨Ë°®Á§∫Êõ¥Êé•ËøëÔºåËøô‰∏™Âú®Âõæ 4 ‰∏≠Áî®Á∫¢Ëâ≤Êõ≤Á∫øË°®Á§∫„ÄÇ Á¨¨‰∫å‰∏™ÂèëÁé∞ÊòØ‰∏çÂêåÁâ©‰ΩìÈó¥ÁöÑÔºöÊ∑ªÂä†Áâ©‰ΩìÊ†áÁ≠æÂêéÔºåÂÖ∑ÊúâÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ËØ≠‰πâÁöÑÂØπË±°Á±ªË∂äÊù•Ë∂äÊé•ËøëÔºà‰ΩÜ‰ªçÂèØÂå∫ÂàÜÔºâ ËÄåËøôÂú®Âü∫Á∫øÊñπÊ≥ï‰∏≠Êúâ‰∫õÊ∑∑ÂêàÔºå‰æãÂ¶ÇÂõæ 4 ‰∏≠Áî®ÁÅ∞Ëâ≤Êõ≤Á∫øË°®Á§∫ÁöÑÂä®Áâ©Ôºàzebra, elephant, sheepÁ≠âÔºâ„ÄÇ ËøôËØÅÊòé‰∫ÜÁâ©‰ΩìÊ†áÁ≠æÂú®Â≠¶‰π†ÂØπÈΩêËØ≠‰πâ‰∏≠ÁöÑÈáçË¶ÅÊÄßÔºöÁâ©‰ΩìË¢´Áî®ÂÅöÂÆö‰ΩçÁÇπÈìæÊé•ÂíåËßÑËåÉÂåñ‰∫ÜË∑®Ê®°ÂºèÁöÑÁâπÂæÅÂ≠¶‰π†„ÄÇ

entry.content: image captionÁªºËø∞AttentionSoft Attention12K. Xu, J. Ba, K. Ryan et al., ‚ÄúShow, attend and tell: neural image caption generation with visual attention,‚Äù in Proceedings of the IEEE Conference on Computer Vision andPattern Recognition, pp. 2048‚Äì2057, Boston, MA, USA, June 2015. Hard Attention12K. Xu, J. Ba, K. Ryan et al., ‚ÄúShow, attend and tell: neural image caption generation with visual attention,‚Äù in Proceedings of the IEEE Conference on Computer Vision andPattern Recognition, pp. 2048‚Äì2057, Boston, MA, USA, June 2015. Multihead Attention (Transformer)1A. Vaswani, N. Shazeer, N. Parmar et al., ‚ÄúAttention is all you need,‚Äù in Proceedings of the Neural Information Processing Systems, Long Beach, CA, USA, December 2017. MultiHead(Q,K,V)=Concate(head_1,¬∑¬∑¬∑,head_h)W^O,\\ wherehead_i=Attention(QW^Q_i,KW^K_i,VW^V_i)Scaled Dot-Product Attention (Transformer)1A. Vaswani, N. Shazeer, N. Parmar et al., ‚ÄúAttention is all you need,‚Äù in Proceedings of the Neural Information Processing Systems, Long Beach, CA, USA, December 2017. Attention(Q,K,V)=softmax(\frac{QK^T}{\sqrt{d_k}})VGlobal Attention1L. Minh-Thang, H. Pham, and C. D. Manning, ‚ÄúEffective approaches to attention-based neural machine translation,‚Äù in Proceedings of the Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing, Lisbon, Portugal, September 2015. Local Attention1L. Minh-Thang, H. Pham, and C. D. Manning, ‚ÄúEffective approaches to attention-based neural machine translation,‚Äù in Proceedings of the Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing, Lisbon, Portugal, September 2015. Adaptive Attention with Visual Sentinel1J. Lu, C. Xiong, D. Parikh, and R. Socher, ‚ÄúKnowing when to look: adaptive attention via a visual sentinel for image captioning,‚Äùin Proceedings of the IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition, pp. 3242‚Äì3250, Las Vegas, NV, USA, June-July 2016. Ct=g(V,ht)=\sum^k_{i=1}\alpha_{ti}v_{ti}=softmax(z_t)¬∑v_{ti}\\ =softmax(w^T_htanh(W_VV+(W_gh_t)I^T))¬∑v_{ti},\\ \hat{c}=\beta_ts_t+(1-\beta_t)c_tSemantic Attention1Q. You, H. Jin, Z. Wang, C. Fang, and J. Luo, ‚ÄúImage captioning with semantic attention,‚Äù in Proceedings of the IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition, pp. 4651‚Äì4659, Las Vegas, NV, USA, June-July 2016. Spatial and Channel-Wise Attention1L. Chen, H. Zhang, J. Xiao et al., ‚ÄúSCA-CNN: spatial and channel-wise attention in convolutional networks for image captioning,‚Äù in Proceedings of the IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR), pp. 6298‚Äì6306, Las Vegas, NV, USA, June-July 2016. Areas of Attention1M. Cornia, L. Baraldi, G. Serra, and R. Cucchiar, ‚ÄúVisual saliency for image captioning in new multimedia services,‚Äù in Proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Multimedia & Expo Workshops (ICMEW), pp. 309‚Äì314, Hong Kong, China, July 2017. Deliberate Attention1L. Gao, K. Fan, J. Song, X. Liu, X. Xu, and H. Shen, ‚ÄúDeliberate attention networks for image captioning,‚Äù in Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence, vol. 33, pp. 8320‚Äì8327, Honolulu, HI, USA, January-February 2019. Dataset MSCOCOMicrosoft COCO Captions dataset , developed by the Microsoft Team that targets scene understanding, captures images from complex daily scenes and can be used to perform multiple tasks such as image recognition, segmentation, and description.The dataset uses Amazon‚Äôs ‚ÄúMechanical Turk‚Äù service to artificially generate at least five sentences for eachimage, with a total of more than 1.5 million sentences. The training set contains 82,783 images, the validation set has 40,504 images, and the test set has 40,775 images. Its 2014 version of the data has a total of about 20G pictures and about 500M of annotation files which mark the correspondence between one image and its descriptions. Flickr8k/Flickr30kFlickr8k image comes from Yahoo‚Äôs photo album site Flickr, which contains 8,000photos, 6000 image training, 1000 image verification, and 1000 image testing. Flickr30k contains 31,783images collected from the Flickr website, mostly depicting humans participating in an event. The corresponding manual label for each image is still 5 sentences. PASCAL 1KA subset of the famous PASCAL VOC challenge image dataset, which provides a standard image annotation dataset and a standard evaluation system. The PASCAL VOC photo collection consists of 20 categories, and for its 20 categories, 50 images were randomly selected for a total of 1,000 images. Then, Amazon‚Äôs Turkish robot service is used to manually mark up five descriptions for each image. The dataset image quality is good and the label is complete, which is very suitable for testing algorithm performance. AIC0e Chinese image description dataset, derived from the AI Challenger, is the first large Chinese description dataset in the field of image caption generation. The dataset contains 210,000 pictures of training sets and 30,000 pictures of verification sets. Similar to MSCOCO, each picture is accompanied by 5 Chinese descriptions, which highlight important information in the image, covering the main characters, scenes, actions, and other contents. Compared with the English datasets common to similar scientific research tasks, Chinese sentences usually have greater flexibility in syntax and lexicalization, and the challenges of algorithm implementation are also greater. STAIRThe Japanese image description dataset, which is constructed based on the images of the MSCOCO dataset. STAIR consists of 164,062 pictures and a total of 820,310 Japanese descriptions corresponding to each of the five pictures. It is the largest Japanese image description dataset. Evaluation Criteria For five indicators, BLEU and METEOR are for machine translations, ROUGE is for automatic summary, and CIDEr and SPICE are present for image caption. They measured the consistency of the n-gram between the generated sentences, which was affected by the significance and rarity of the n-gram. At the same time, all four indicators can be directly calculated by the MSCOCO title assessment tool. The source code is publicly available. BLEUIt is the most widely used evaluation indicator; the original intention of the design is not for the imagecaption problem, but for the machine translation problem based on the accuracy rate evaluation. It is used to analyze the correlation of n-gram between the translation statement to be evaluated and the reference translation statement. Its core idea is that the closer the machine translation statement is to a human professional translation statement, the better the performance. In this task, the processing is the same asmachine translation: multiple images are equivalent to multiple source language sentences in the translation. The higher the BLEU score, the better the performance. The advantage of BLEU is that the granularity it considers is an n-gram rather than a word, considering longer matching information. The disadvantage of BLEU is that no matter what kind of n-gram is matched, it will be treated the same. For example, the importance of verb matching should be intuitively greater than the article. METEORMETEOR is also used to evaluate machine translation, which aligns the translation generates from the model with the reference translation and matches the accuracy, recall, and F-value of various cases. What makes METEOR special is that it does not want to generate very ‚Äúbroken‚Äù translations and the method is based on the precision of one gram and the harmonic mean of the recall. The weight of the recall is a bit higher than the precision. This criterion also has features that are not available in others. It is designed to solve some of the problems with BLEU. It is highly relevant to human judgment and, unlike BLEU, it has a high correlation with human judgment not only at the entire collection but also at the sentence and segment level. The higher the METEOR score, the better the performance. ROUGEROUGE is a set of automated evaluation criteria designed to evaluate text summarization algorithms.The higher the ROUGE score, the better the performance. CIDErCIDEr is specifically designed for image annotation problems. It measures the consistency of image annotation by performing a Term Frequency-Inverse Document Frequency (TF-IDF) weight calculation for each n-gram. This indicator treats each sentence as a ‚Äúdocument,‚Äù represents it in the form of a TF-IDF vector, and then calculates the cosine similarity of the reference description to the description generated by the model as a score. In other words, it is the vector space model. This indicator compensates for one of the disadvantages of BLEU, that is, all words on the match are treated the same, but in fact, some words should be more important. Again, the higher the CIDEr score, the better the performance. SPICEIt is a semantic evaluation indicator for image caption that measures how image titles effectively recover objects, attributes, and relationships between them. On the natural image caption dataset, SPICE is better able to capture human judgments about the model‚Äôs subtitles, rather than the existing n-gram metrics.

Á´ØÈÖçÁΩÆ‰∏éÊ®°ÂûãÊñá‰ª∂ÊâÄÂú®ÁõÆÂΩï„ÄÇ threadÔºöServer Á´ØÁ∫øÁ®ãÊï∞„ÄÇ portÔºöServer Á´ØÈ¢ÑÊµãÊúçÂä°Á´ØÂè£Âè∑„ÄÇ nameÔºöHTTP È¢ÑÊµãÊúçÂä°ÁöÑÁöÑÂêçÁß∞ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏çÊåáÂÆö nameÔºåÂàô‰ºöÂêØÂä® RPC 0.1856, 0.0795, -0.0332]}], "fetch":["price"]}' http://127.0.0.1:9292/uci/prediction ÊñáÊú¨ËØ≠‰πâÊ®°ÂûãBert‰∏ãËΩΩÊ®°ÂûãÁõÆÊ†áÊòØÁªôÂÆöËæìÂÖ•‰∏Ä‰∏™Âè•Â≠êÔºåÊé®ÁêÜÊúçÂä°ÂèØ‰ª•Â∞ÜÂè•Â≠êË°®Á§∫Êàê‰∏Ä‰∏™ËØ≠‰πâÂêëÈáèËøîÂõûÁªôÂÆ¢Êà∑Á´Ø„ÄÇ 1234567891011121314151617import paddlehub as trainable=True, max_seq_len=20)#Â∞ÜËæìÂÖ•ËæìÂá∫ÁöÑÂêçÁß∞‰∏éÊ®°Âûã‰∏≠ÁöÑËæìÂÖ•ËæìÂá∫ÂèòÈáè‰∏Ä‰∏ÄÊò†Â∞Ñfeed_keys = ["input_ids", "position_ids", "segment_ids", "input_mask", ]fetch_keys = fetch_keys]))#‰øùÂ≠òservingÈúÄË¶ÅÁöÑÊ®°Âûã‰∏éÈÖçÁΩÆÊñá‰ª∂ÔºåÂèÇÊï∞1ÊòØserverÁ´ØÊ®°Âûã‰∏éÈÖçÁΩÆÊñá‰ª∂‰øùÂ≠òÁöÑÁõÆÂΩïÔºåÂèÇÊï∞2ÊòØclientÁ´ØÈÖçÁΩÆÊñá‰ª∂‰øùÂ≠òÁöÑÁõÆÂΩïÔºåÂèÇÊï∞3ÊòØËæìÂÖ•dictÔºåÂèÇÊï∞4ÊòØËæìÂá∫dictÔºåÂèÇÊï∞5ÊòØÊ®°ÂûãÁöÑprogramimport No such file or directory ÂèÇËÄÉ 12345678910111213141516171819202122Python3ÁéØÂ¢É‰∏ãÔºåimport cv2 ÊèêÁ§∫ ImportError: libSM.so.6: cannot open shared object file: No such file or cannot open shared object file: No such file or directoryapt-get updateapt-get install -y libglib2.0-dev ÊúÄÂêé‰∏ÄË°åÁöÑÁªìÊûú ËØçÊ≥ïÂàÜËØçLAC‰∏ãËΩΩÊ®°Âûã1hub install lac==2.2.0 ÂëΩ‰ª§Ë°åÈ¢ÑÊµãÔºö 123456789101112hub run lac --input_text "‰ªäÂ§©ÊòØ‰∏™Â•ΩÊó•Â≠ê"hub run lac --input_file test.txt --user_dict user.dict# test.txt Â≠òÊîæÂæÖÂàÜËØçÊñáÊú¨‰ªäÂ§©ÊòØ‰∏™Â•ΩÊó•Â≠ê ‰ªäÂ§©Â§©Ê∞îÊô¥Êúó # user.dict‰∏∫Áî®Êà∑Ëá™ÂÆö‰πâËØçÂÖ∏ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•‰∏çÊåáÂÆöÔºåÂΩìÊåáÂÆöËá™ÂÆö‰πâËØçÂÖ∏Êó∂ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Âπ≤È¢ÑÈªòËÆ§ÂàÜËØçÁªìÊûúÊò•Â§©/SEASONËä±/n ÂºÄ/vÁßãÂ§©ÁöÑÈ£éËêΩ Èò≥ Êú¨Âú∞ËøêË°å12345678910import paddlehub as batch_size=1, return_tag=True)for result in results: print(result['word']) print(result['tag']) ÂêØÂä®ÊúçÂä°1hub serving start -m lac -p 9292 ÊµãËØï123456789101112131415161718import requestsimport pyramidbox_face_detection==1.1.0 ÊµãËØï1234567891011121314import paddlehub as hubimport osdef run(img_name): face_detector = hub.Module(name="./pyramidbox_face_detection") path = './images/' result = [os.path.join(path, style_img_name)] }] , visualization=True) print(result[0]['save_path']) return result[0]['save_path']if __name__ == "__main__": print(run('1.jpg', 'picasso.png')) ÁõÆÊ†áÊ£ÄÊµãSSDÂèÇËÄÉ ‰∏ãËΩΩÊ®°ÂûãÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøá‰ª£Á†Å‰∏ãËΩΩ 1ssd = hub.Module(name="ssd_mobilenet_v1_pascal") ‰πüÂèØ‰ª•ÂÆâË£Ö 1hub install ssd_mobilenet_v1_pascal==1.1.1 images]}headers = {"Content-type": "application/json"}url = "http://127.0.0.1:9292/predict/ssd_mobilenet_v1_pascal"r = requests.post(url=url, headers=headers, data=json.dumps(data))# of code# org_img = images[index - unhandled_paths_num]org_img = images[handle_id] ÂõæÂÉèÂàÜÁ±ªEfficientNet b7‰∏ãËΩΩÊ®°Âûãhub install efficientnetb7_imagenet==1.1.0 Êú¨Âú∞ËøêË°å1234567891011import classifier.classify(images=[cv2.imread(os.path.join(path, image)) for image in images])for result in results: print(result) ÂêØÂä®ÊúçÂä°1hub serving start -m efficientnetb7_imagenet -p 9292 base64.b64encode(data.tostring()).decode('utf8')path = "./images/"images = os.listdir(path)# ÂèëÈÄÅHTTPËØ∑Ê±Çdata = {'images':[cv2_to_base64(cv2.imread(os.path.join(path, image))) for image in images]}headers = {"Content-type": "application/json"}url = "http://127.0.0.1:9292/predict/efficientnetb7_imagenet"r = requests.post(url=url, headers=headers, data=json.dumps(data))# ÊâìÂç∞È¢ÑÊµãÁªìÊûúprint(r.json()["results"]) ÊñáÂ≠óËØÜÂà´Chinese_text_detection‰∏ãËΩΩÊ®°Âûã1$ hub install chinese_text_detection_db_server==1.0.2 ÂëΩ‰ª§Ë°åÈ¢ÑÊµãÔºöhub run chinese_text_detection_db_server --input_path "/PATH/TO/IMAGE" Êú¨Âú∞ËøêË°å visualization = True 12345678910111213import paddlehub as hubimport cv2import ospath = './images/'images = os.listdir(path)text_detector = hub.Module(name="chinese_text_detection_db_server")results = text_detector.detect_text(images=[cv2.imread(os.path.join(path, image)) for image in images], visualization = True)for result in results: print(result)# or# result = ocr.recognize_text(paths=['/PATH/TO/IMAGE']) Êä•Èîô from shapely.geos import lgeosÔºö conda install -c conda-forge shapely ÂêØÂä®ÊúçÂä°1hub serving start -m chinese_text_detection_db_server -p 9292 ÊµãËØï12345678910111213141516171819202122import requestsimport jsonimport cv2import base64import osdef cv2_to_base64(image): data = cv2.imencode('.jpg', image)[1] return base64.b64encode(data.tostring()).decode('utf8')path = './images/'images = os.listdir(path)# ÂèëÈÄÅHTTPËØ∑Ê±Çdata = {'images': [cv2_to_base64(cv2.imread(os.path.join(path, image))) for image in images], 'visualization':True}headers = {"Content-type": "application/json"}url = Mobilechinese_ocr_db_crnn_server ËøêË°å‰∏≠ÈúÄË¶ÅÁöÑÂÜÖÂ≠òËµÑÊ∫êÂ§™Â§ß‰∫Ü ‰∏ãËΩΩÁöÑÊòØ chinese_ocr_db_crnn_mobile ‰∏ãËΩΩÊ®°Âûã1hub install chinese_ocr_db_crnn_mobile==1.1.0 ÂëΩ‰ª§Ë°åÊµãËØïÔºö hub run chinese_ocr_db_crnn_mobile --input_path './images/3.jpg' Êú¨Âú∞ËøêË°å visualization = True 1234567891011import paddlehub as hubimport cv2import ospath = './images/'images = os.listdir(path)ocr = hub.Module(name="chinese_ocr_db_crnn_mobile")results = ocr.recognize_text(images=[cv2.imread(os.path.join(path, image)) for image in images], visualization=True)for result in results: print(result) ÂêØÂä®ÊúçÂä°1hub serving start -m chinese_ocr_db_crnn_mobile -p 9292 ÊµãËØï12345678910111213141516171819202122import requestsimport jsonimport cv2import base64import osdef cv2_to_base64(image): data = cv2.imencode('.jpg', image)[1] return base64.b64encode(data.tostring()).decode('utf8')path = './images'images = os.listdir(path)# ÂèëÈÄÅHTTPËØ∑Ê±Çdata = {'images': [cv2_to_base64(cv2.imread(os.path.join(path, image))) for image in images], 'visualization':True}headers = {"Content-type": "application/json"}url = "http://127.0.0.1:9292/predict/chinese_ocr_db_crnn_mobile"r = requests.post(url=url, headers=headers, data=json.dumps(data))# ÊâìÂç∞È¢ÑÊµãÁªìÊûúprint(r.json()["results"]) ÂõæÂÉèÂàÜÂâ≤Humanseg Mobile‰∏ãËΩΩÊ®°Âûã1hub install humanseg_mobile==1.1.0 ÂëΩ‰ª§Ë°åËøêË°åÔºöhub run humanseg_mobile --input_path "/PATH/TO/IMAGE" Êú¨Âú∞ËøêË°å1234567891011121314import cv2import paddlehub as hubimport ospath = './images'images = os.listdir(path)human_seg = hub.Module(directory='humanseg_mobile')# visualization=TrueÂèØ‰ª•Áî®‰∫éÊü•ÁúãË∂ÖÂàÜÂõæÁâáÊïàÊûúÔºåÂèØËÆæÁΩÆ‰∏∫FalseÊèêÂçáËøêË°åÈÄüÂ∫¶„ÄÇres = human_seg.segment(images=[cv2.imread(os.path.join(path, image)) for image in images], visualization=True)for r in res: print(r['save_path'])# human_seg.video_segment('/PATH/TO/VIDEO')# human_seg.save_inference_model('/PATH/TO/SAVE/MODEL') Áõ¥Êé•ËøêË°åÁöÑËØùÔºå‰∏Ä‰∏™Êñá‰ª∂Â§π‰∏≠ÁöÑÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÂõæÁâáÂè™Êúâ‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜËÉΩÂæóÂà∞ÁªìÊûúÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫Ê∫êÁ†Å‰∏≠ÊåâÁÖßÊó∂Èó¥Êà≥ÂëΩÂêç‰øùÂ≠òÂõæÁâáÔºåËøêË°åÁöÑÂ§™Âø´‰ºöË¶ÜÁõñÊéâ‰πãÂâçÁöÑ„ÄÇ ‰øÆÊîπprocess‰∏≠get_save_image_nameÔºåÁõ¥Êé•‰ΩøÁî®ÈöèÊú∫Êï∞ 12345678ext = '.png't = time.strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S_", time.localtime())rand = random.randint(0, 1000000)save_im_path = os.path.join(output_dir, t + str(rand) + ext)while os.path.exists(save_im_path): save_im_path = os.path.join(output_dir, t + str(random.randint(0, 1000000)) + ext)return save_im_path ÂêØÂä®ÊúçÂä°1hub serving start -m humanseg_mobile -p 9292 ÊµãËØï1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738import requestsimport jsonimport base64import cv2import numpy as npimport osdef cv2_to_base64(image): data = cv2.imencode('.jpg', image)[1] return base64.b64encode(data.tostring()).decode('utf8')def base64_to_cv2(b64str): data = base64.b64decode(b64str.encode('utf8')) data = np.fromstring(data, np.uint8) data = cv2.imdecode(data, cv2.IMREAD_COLOR) return data# ÂèëÈÄÅHTTPËØ∑Ê±Çpath = './images'images = os.listdir(path)outpath = './serving_image_results/'if not os.path.exists(outpath):os.mkdir(outpath)data = {'images': [cv2_to_base64(cv2.imread(os.path.join(path, image))) for image in images]}headers = {"Content-type": "application/json"}url = "http://127.0.0.1:9292/predict/humanseg_mobile"rs = requests.post(url=url, headers=headers, data=json.dumps(data))imagesdata = rs.json()['results']for i in range(len(imagesdata)): mask = cv2.cvtColor(base64_to_cv2(imagesdata[i]['data']), cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY) org_im = cv2.imread(os.path.join(path, images[i])) rgba = np.concatenate((org_im, np.expand_dims(mask, axis=2)), axis=2) print(outpath+str(i)+".png") cv2.imwrite(outpath+str(i)+".png", rgba)

entry.title: ÁõÆÊ†áÊ£ÄÊµã‰ª£Á†Å
entry.content: Ë°ÄÁªÜËÉûÊ£ÄÊµãÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ ÂèÇËÄÉÁΩëÂùÄ faster R-CNN weights -500epochs ‰ΩøÁî®faster R-CNNÊ°ÜÊû∂ÔºåcsvËá™ÂÆö‰πâÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ„ÄÇÂü∫‰∫étensorflowÂíåkeras„ÄÇ Êï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÂ§ÑÁêÜcsvÊñá‰ª∂Ë¶ÅÊ±ÇÁöÑÊ†ºÂºè‰∏∫Ôºöfilepath,x1,y1,x2,y2,class_name BCCDÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ‰∏≠Â∑≤ÁªèÁªôÂ•Ω‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™csvÊ†ºÂºèÁöÑtestÔºö train.txt test.txtÁªôÂá∫‰∫ÜËÆ≠ÁªÉÈõÜÂíåÊµãËØïÈõÜÁöÑÂõæÁâáÂêçÔºö Â∞ÜÁªôÂá∫ÁöÑtest.csvÈáçÂëΩÂêç‰∏∫all.csvÔºåÊåâÁÖßtrain.txtÂíåtest.txtÁªôÂá∫Áõ∏Â∫îÁöÑtrain.csvÂíåtest.csv 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041import csvfile = open('./test.csv')train = open('./train.txt')test = open('./test.txt')trainList = train.read().splitlines() # 205testList = test.read().splitlines() # 72lines = file.read().splitlines() # 4889file.close()train.close()test.close()all = []for line in lines: line = line.split(',') line[0] = line[0].replace('.jpg', '') all.append(line)all = all[1:] #Á¨¨‰∏ÄË°å‰∏∫filenameÁ≠âÊñá‰ª∂Â§¥traincsv = [["image_names", "cell_type", "xmin", "xmax", "ymin", "ymax"]] # 2805testcsv = [["image_names", "cell_type", "xmin", "xmax", "ymin", "ymax"]] # 2083for i in all: if i[0] in trainList: traincsv.append(i) else: testcsv.append(i)def write(name, row): with open(name + '.csv', 'w', newline='')as csvfile: writer = csv.writer(csvfile) for c in row: writer.writerow(c)write("train", traincsv)write("test", testcsv) ËÆ≠ÁªÉÊó∂ÈúÄË¶ÅÁöÑÊòØtxtÊñá‰ª∂ÔºåÂ∞ÜcsvËΩ¨‰∏∫txt 12345678910111213141516import pandas as pdtrain = pd.read_csv('train.csv')data = pd.DataFrame()data['format'] = train['image_names']# as the images are in train_images folder, add train_images before the image namefor i in range(data.shape[0]): data['format'][i] = 'path' + data['format'][i]+'.jpg'# add xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax and class as per the format requiredfor i in range(data.shape[0]): data['format'][i] = data['format'][i] + ',' + str(train['xmin'][i]) + ',' + str(train['ymin'][i]) + ',' + str(train['xmax'][i]) + ',' + str(train['ymax'][i]) + ',' + train['cell_type'][i]data.to_csv('annotate.txt', header=None, index=None, sep=' ') train12cd keras-frcnnpython train_frcnn.py -o simple -p annotate.txt testÊµãËØïÊó∂ÈúÄË¶ÅÊääÊµãËØïÁî®ÁöÑÂõæÁâáÊîæÂà∞‰∏Ä‰∏™Êñá‰ª∂Â§π‰∏ã 123456789101112131415import pandas as pdimport shutilimport ostest = pd.read_csv('test.csv')names = test['image_names'].unique()oldpath = '...\BCCD\JPEGImages\\'newpath = '...\keras-frcnn\\test_images\\'for name in names: if os.path.exists(oldpath+name+'.jpg'): shutil.copy(oldpath+name+'.jpg', newpath+name+'.jpg') else: continue test_frcnn.pyÊúÄÂêéÊîπÊàê 123# cv2.imshow('img',img)# cv2.waitKey(0)cv2.imwrite('./results_imgs/{}.png'.format(os.path.splitext(str(img_name))[0]), img) ÁªìÊûú RetinaNet on cocoÊ∫êÁ†Å cocoÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÂú®aistudioÈáå‰∏ãËΩΩ 12345Áî®cocoÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÁöÑËØùÔºåÊï¥ÁêÜÊàê‰ª•‰∏ãÂΩ¢Âºèval2017 ---- annotations ---- instances_val2017.json | -- images ---- val2017 cocoËÆ≠ÁªÉ1python train.py --dataset coco --coco_path E:\Python\ObjDetection\datasets\val2017 --depth 50 ÊµãËØï1python coco_validation.py --coco_path E:\Python\ObjDetection\datasets\val2017 --model_path ./coco_resnet_50_map_0_335_state_dict.pt ÊåáÂÆöÂõæÁâáÂèØËßÜÂåñÂ∞ÜÈúÄË¶ÅÂèØËßÜÂåñÁöÑÂõæÁâáÊîæÂà∞visualÊñá‰ª∂Â§πÈáå ÈúÄË¶Å‰øÆÊîπ‰∏ÄÈÉ®ÂàÜ‰ª£Á†ÅÔºåÊ∫êÁ†ÅÂè™Âä†ËΩΩ‰∫Üstate_dictÊ≤°ÊúâÊåáÂÆöÊ®°ÂûãÔºåÂú®visulize_single_image.py‰∏≠ÂØºÂÖ•retinanet from retinanet import modelÔºåÁÑ∂Âêé‰ª£Á†ÅÈáåÂÖàÊåáÂÆöÊ®°Âûã 123456retina = model.resnet50(num_classes=80)retina.load_state_dict(torch.load(model_path))if torch.cuda.is_available(): retina = retina.cuda()retina.training = Falseretina.eval() 1python visualize_single_image.py --image_dir ./visual --model_path ./coco_resnet_50_map_0_335_state_dict.pt --class_list ./coco_classes_list.csv ËøôÁßçÊñπÊ≥ïËøòÈúÄË¶ÅÁîüÊàêcocoÁöÑclasses_listÊ†ºÂºè‰∏∫ class_name,id cocoÂèØËßÜÂåñÂêåÊ†∑ÈúÄË¶ÅÂä†ËΩΩretinanetÊ®°Âûã 12retinanet = model.resnet50(num_classes=80)retinanet.load_state_dict(torch.load(parser.model)) 1python visualize.py --dataset coco --coco_path ...\datasets\val2017 --model ./coco_resnet_50_map_0_335_state_dict.pt Êåâ‰∏ãÈîÆÊç¢‰∏ã‰∏ÄÂº†ÂõæÁâá csvÊåâÁÖßË¶ÅÊ±ÇÁîüÊàêÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÊ†ºÂºèÁöÑcsvÊñá‰ª∂Ôºå‚Äòpath/to/image.jpg,x1,y1,x2,y2,class_name‚Äô Áî®ÁôæÂ∫¶ÁöÑfruitÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÔºåËß£ÊûêxmlÊñá‰ª∂ÔºåÁîüÊàêtrain.csv„ÄÅtest.csv„ÄÅclasses.csv 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344454647484950515253545556575859606162636465666768697071727374<annotation> <folder>train</folder> <filename>apple_3.jpg</filename> <path>C:\tensorflow1\models\research\object_detection\images\train\apple_3.jpg</path> <source> <database>Unknown</database> </source> <size> <width>1000</width> <height>708</height> <depth>3</depth> </size> <segmented>0</segmented> <object> <name>apple</name> <pose>Unspecified</pose> <truncated>1</truncated> <difficult>0</difficult> <bndbox> <xmin>584</xmin> <ymin>438</ymin> <xmax>867</xmax> <ymax>708</ymax> </bndbox> </object> <object> <name>apple</name> <pose>Unspecified</pose> <truncated>0</truncated> <difficult>0</difficult> <bndbox> <xmin>492</xmin> <ymin>141</ymin> <xmax>740</xmax> <ymax>394</ymax> </bndbox> </object> <object> <name>apple</name> <pose>Unspecified</pose> <truncated>0</truncated> <difficult>0</difficult> <bndbox> <xmin>176</xmin> <ymin>199</ymin> <xmax>490</xmax> <ymax>466</ymax> </bndbox> </object> <object> <name>apple</name> <pose>Unspecified</pose> <truncated>0</truncated> <difficult>0</difficult> <bndbox> <xmin>367</xmin> <ymin>17</ymin> <xmax>619</xmax> <ymax>240</ymax> </bndbox> </object> <object> <name>apple</name> <pose>Unspecified</pose> <truncated>0</truncated> <difficult>0</difficult> <bndbox> <xmin>642</xmin> <ymin>35</ymin> <xmax>907</xmax> <ymax>269</ymax> </bndbox> </object></annotation> 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657import csvimport xml.etree.ElementTree as ETimport osdef createall(): filepath = "...\datasets\\fruit-detection\Annotations" pathdir = os.listdir(filepath) List = [] for file in pathdir: temppath = filepath + '\\' + file tree = ET.parse(temppath) root = tree.getroot() for i in root.iter('object'): temp = [] temp.append("...\datasets\\fruit-detection\JPEGImages\\"+file.split('.')[0]+'.jpg') for j in i.find('bndbox'): temp.append(j.text) temp.append(root.find('object').find('name').text) List.append(temp) write("all", List)def write(name, row): with open(name + '.csv', 'w', newline='')as csvfile: writer = csv.writer(csvfile) for c in row: writer.writerow(c)def createsplit(): trainfile = open("...\datasets\\fruit-detection\ImageSets\Main\\train.txt") allcsv = open("./all.csv") List = allcsv.read().splitlines() lines = trainfile.readlines() lines = [i.strip() for i in lines] trainfile.close() allcsv.close() trainlist = [] vallist = [] for i in List: if i.strip().split('.')[0].split('\\')[-1] in lines: trainlist.append(i.split(',')) else: vallist.append(i.split(',')) write("train", trainlist) write("val", vallist)def createclass(): L = [['apple', 0], ['banana', 1], ['orange', 2]] write('classes', L)# write("all", List)# createaplit()createsplit() ËÆ≠ÁªÉ Unexpected bus error encountered in worker. This might be caused by insufficient shared memory (shm) Âá∫Áé∞Ëøô‰∏™ÈîôËØØÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµÊòØÔºåÂú®ÊúçÂä°Âô®‰∏äÁöÑdocker‰∏≠ËøêË°åËÆ≠ÁªÉ‰ª£Á†ÅÊó∂Ôºåbatch sizeËÆæÁΩÆÂæóËøáÂ§ßÔºåshared memory‰∏çÂ§üÔºàÂõ†‰∏∫dockerÈôêÂà∂‰∫ÜshmÔºâ.Ëß£ÂÜ≥ÊñπÊ≥ïÊòØÔºåÂ∞ÜDataloaderÁöÑnum_workersËÆæÁΩÆ‰∏∫0. 1CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=4 python ./train.py --dataset csv --csv_train ./csv/train1.csv --csv_classes ./csv/classes.csv --csv_val ./csv/val1.csv Attempted to read a PyTorch file with version 3, but the maximum supported version for reading is 2. Âõ†‰∏∫ÊúçÂä°Âô®ÁâàÊú¨ÂíåÊú¨Êú∫ÁâàÊú¨‰∏ç‰∏ÄËá¥Ôºå‰ΩÜÊõ¥Êñ∞‰∫ÜcondaËøòÊòØ‰∏çË°å ‰øÆÊîπvisualize_single_image 1234# cv2.imshow('detections', image_orig)# cv2.waitKey(0)print(img_name)cv2.imwrite('./fruit_results/{}.png'.format(img_name.split('.')[0]), image_orig) Áõ¥Êé•Â∞ÜÂõæÁâá‰øùÂ≠òÂú®ÊúçÂä°Âô®‰∏ä 1CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=4 python ./visualize_single_image.py --image_dir ./visual_fruit --model_path ./checkpoint/model_final.pt --class_list ./fruit_classes_list.csv ‚Äã ‚Äã

entry.title: EfficientDet
entry.content: EfficientNetEfficientNet: Rethinking Model Scaling for Convolutional Neural NetworksËÆ∫ÊñáÈìæÊé•Ôºö https://arxiv.org/pdf/1905.11946.pdfÂÆòÊñπÊ∫êÁ†ÅÔºö https://github.com/tensorflow/tpu/tree/master/models/official/efficientnetÁ¨¨‰∏âÊñπPyTorchÊ∫êÁ†ÅÔºö https://github.com/lukemelas/EfficientNet-PyTorch ÁÆÄ‰ªã ‰∏ÄËà¨ÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÈÄöËøáÊâ©Â§ßÁΩëÁªúÊ∑±Â∫¶„ÄÅÂÆΩÂ∫¶„ÄÅÂàÜËæ®ÁéáÔºàÂ¶ÇGpipeÈááÁî®480*480ÁöÑÂõæÂÉèÔºâ Êù•ÊèêÂçáÊ®°ÂûãÁ≤æÂ∫¶„ÄÇ‰ΩúËÄÖÊèêÂá∫‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÁßçcompound scaling method ÔºåÁªºÂêàËÄÉËôëÊ∑±Â∫¶„ÄÅÂÆΩÂ∫¶„ÄÅÂàÜËæ®Áéá„ÄÇ Depth„ÄÅWidth„ÄÅResolution ‰∏Ä‰∏™Âç∑ÁßØÂ±Ç$i$ÂèØ‰ª•Ë¢´ÂÆö‰πâ‰∏∫‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂáΩÊï∞Ôºö$Y_i = F_i ( X_i )$ÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ÊòØ$F_i$Âç∑ÁßØÊìç‰ΩúÔºå$Y_i$ÊòØËæìÂá∫ÁöÑÂº†ÈáèÔºå$X_i$ÊòØËæìÂÖ•ÁöÑÂº†Èáè‰∏îÂº†ÈáèÁöÑÂΩ¢Áä∂‰∏∫$(H_i, W_i, C_i)$„ÄÇÊ≠§Â§ñCNNÈÄöÂ∏∏Ë¢´ÂàíÂàÜ‰∏∫Â§ö‰∏™Èò∂ÊÆµÔºåÊØè‰∏™Èò∂ÊÆµÁöÑÊâÄÊúâÂ±ÇÁªìÊûÑÊòØÁõ∏ÂêåÁöÑÔºåÊØîÂ¶ÇResNet‰∏≠Êúâ‰∫î‰∏™Èò∂ÊÆµÔºåÊØè‰∏™Èò∂ÊÆµÁöÑÊâÄÊúâÂ±ÇÈÉΩÂÖ∑ÊúâÁõ∏ÂêåÁöÑÂç∑ÁßØÁ±ªÂûãÔºåÈô§‰∫ÜÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÂ±ÇÊâßË°å‰∏ãÈááÊ†∑„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§‰∏Ä‰∏™Á•ûÁªèÁΩëÁªú$N$ÂèØ‰ª•Ë°®Á§∫‰∏∫ÂÖ∂‰∏≠$F_i^{L_i}$Ë°®Á§∫Âú®Á¨¨$i$‰∏™Èò∂ÊÆµÁöÑÁ¨¨$L_i$Ê¨°ÈáçÂ§çÁöÑ$F_i$Â±ÇÔºå$(H_i,W_i,C_i)$ÊòØÁ¨¨$i$Â±ÇËæìÂÖ•ÁöÑÂº†Èáè$X$ÂΩ¢Áä∂„ÄÇ‰∏çÂêå‰∫é‰πãÂâçÊôÆÈÄöÁöÑÁΩëÁªúËÆæËÆ°ÊòØÈõÜ‰∏≠Âú®ÂØªÊâæÊõ¥Â•ΩÁöÑ$F_i$Â±ÇÊû∂ÊûÑÔºåÊ®°ÂûãÁº©ÊîæÂàôÊòØÊâ©Â±ïÁΩëÁªúÈïøÂ∫¶„ÄÅÂÆΩÂ∫¶ÂíåÂàÜËæ®Áéá($H_i,W_i$ÔºâËÄå‰∏çÊîπÂèòbaselineÁΩëÁªú‰∏≠ÁöÑ$F_i$„ÄÇ‰∏∫‰∫ÜËøõ‰∏ÄÊ≠•ÂáèÂ∞ëËÆæËÆ°Á©∫Èó¥ÁöÑÂ§ßÂ∞èÔºåÈôêÂà∂ÊâÄÊúâÂèÇÊï∞ÂøÖÈ°ª‰ª•ÊÅíÂÆöÁöÑÊØî‰æãÂùáÂåÄÂú∞Áº©Êîæ„ÄÇÁõÆÊ†áÊòØ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂú®ÁªôÂÆöËµÑÊ∫êÈôêÂà∂Êó∂ÊúÄÂ§ßÂåñÊ®°ÂûãÁ≤æÂ∫¶ÔºåÂèØ‰ª•Ë¢´ÂÆö‰πâ‰∏∫‰∏Ä‰∏™‰ºòÂåñÈóÆÈ¢òÔºöÂÖ∂‰∏≠$w,d,r$ÊòØÂØπÁΩëÁªúÁöÑÂÆΩÂ∫¶„ÄÅÊ∑±Â∫¶ÂíåÂàÜËæ®ÁéáÁº©ÊîæÁöÑÂèÇÊï∞Ôºå$\hat{F_i},\hat{L_i},\hat{H_i},\hat{W_i},\hat{C_i}$ÊòØbaselineÁΩëÁªú‰∏≠È¢ÑÂÖàÂÆö‰πâÂ•ΩÁöÑÂèÇÊï∞ ÈÄöËøáÂ¢ûÂä†ÂÆΩÂ∫¶„ÄÅÊ∑±Â∫¶„ÄÅÂàÜËæ®ÁéáÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•‰∏ÄÂÆöÁ®ãÂ∫¶‰∏äÊèêÂçáÂáÜÁ°ÆÁéá„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØÂØπ‰∫éÂ§ßÂûãÁΩëÁªúÊèêÂçáÊúâÈôêÔºàResNet 1000 Âíå ResNet 101ÂáÜÂ§áÁéáÁõ∏‰ººÔºâ ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞ÂΩìÁ≤æÂ∫¶ËææÂà∞80%Â∑¶Âè≥Êó∂‰ºöÈ•±Âíå„ÄÇ Compound scaling method $Œ±,Œ≤,Œ≥$ÊòØÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøáÂ∞èÂûãÁΩëÊ†ºÊêúÁ¥¢Á°ÆÂÆöÁöÑÂ∏∏ÈáèÔºåËÄå$œï$‰ªéÁõ¥ËßÇ‰∏äËß£ÈáäÊòØÊòØÁî®Êà∑ÊåâÁÖßËÉΩÂ§üÊèê‰æõÁöÑÈ¢ùÂ§ñËÆ°ÁÆóËµÑÊ∫êÂºÄÈîÄÔºàÁõ∏ÂØπ‰∫ébaselineÂ∞ÜÁΩëÁªúÊâ©Â±ïÊó∂ÈúÄË¶ÅÈ¢ùÂ§ñËÆ°ÁÆóËµÑÊ∫êÔºâÁöÑÂ§öÂ∞ëÊù•ÊåáÂÆöÁöÑÂèÇÊï∞„ÄÇ$Œ± , Œ≤ , Œ≥$ÂàôÊòØÁ°ÆÂÆöÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂàÜÂà´‰∏∫ÁΩëÁªúÂÆΩÂ∫¶„ÄÅÊ∑±Â∫¶ÂíåÂàÜËæ®ÁéáÂàÜÈÖçËøô‰∫õÈ¢ùÂ§ñËµÑÊ∫ê„ÄÇ Â∏∏ËßÑÂç∑ÁßØËøêÁÆóÁöÑFLOPS‰∏é$d,w^2,r^2$ÊàêÊ≠£ÊØîÔºå‰æãÂ¶ÇÂ∞ÜÁΩëÁªúÊ∑±Â∫¶Âä†ÂÄç‰ºöÂä†ÂÄçFLOPSÔºåËÄåÂ∞ÜÁΩëÁªúÂÆΩÂ∫¶ÊàñËÄÖÂàÜËæ®ÁéáÂä†ÂÄç‰ºö‰ΩøÂæóFLOPSÂ§ßËá¥Â¢ûÂä†ÂõõÂÄçÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Áî®‰∏äËø∞ÂÖ¨ÂºèÂØπÁΩëÁªúËøõË°åÁº©ÊîæÊó∂Ôºå‰ºö‰ΩøÂæóÊÄª‰ΩìFLOPSÂ¢ûÂä†Â§ßÁ∫¶$(\alpha\cdot\beta^2\cdot\gamma^2)^œï$ÂÄçÔºåÂú®Êú¨Êñá‰∏≠ÔºåÈÄöËøáÁ∫¶Êùü$ \alpha\cdot\beta^2\cdot\gamma^2\approx2$‰ΩøÂæóÂØπ‰ªªÊÑèÁöÑ$\phi$Êï¥‰ΩìÁöÑFLOPSÂ∞Ü‰ºöÂ¢ûÂä†$2^\phi$ÂÄç EfficientNet ArchitectureÈ¶ñÂÖà‰ΩúËÄÖ‰ΩøÁî®MnasNetÁöÑÊñπÊ≥ïÔºåÂà©Áî®Â§öÁõÆÊ†áÁ•ûÁªèÁΩëÁªúÊû∂ÊûÑÊêúÁ¥¢ÔºåÂêåÊó∂‰ºòÂåñÂáÜÁ°ÆÁéáÂíåFLOPSÔºåÂæóÂà∞‰∫ÜFLOPS‰∏∫400MÁöÑbaselineÁΩëÁªúEfficientNet-B0ÔºåÁΩëÁªúÊû∂ÊûÑÂ¶Ç‰∏ãË°® ÁÑ∂Âêé‰ªéËøô‰∏™baselineÁùÄÊâãÔºå‰ΩøÁî®‰∏§‰∏™Ê≠•È™§Ôºö STEP 1Ôºö Âõ∫ÂÆö$\phi=1$ÔºåÂç≥ÂÅáËÆæÊúâ‰∏§ÂÄç‰ª•‰∏äÁöÑÂèØÁî®ËµÑÊ∫êÔºåÂπ∂ÂÅö‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∞èÁöÑÁΩëÊ†ºÊêúÁ¥¢ÂæóÂà∞‰∫ÜÊúÄ‰Ω≥ÂÄº$Œ± = 1.2 , Œ≤ = 1.1 , Œ≥ = 1.15$ÔºåÂú®$\alpha\cdot\beta^2\cdot\gamma^2\approx2$ÁöÑÁ∫¶Êùü‰∏ã„ÄÇËøôÊ†∑ÂÅöÁöÑÂéüÂõ†ÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫Âú®Â§ßÊ®°Âûã‰∏äÊêúÁ¥¢ÊàêÊú¨Â§™È´ò‰∫Ü„ÄÇ STEP 2Ôºö Âõ∫ÂÆö$\alpha,\beta,\gamma$Âπ∂‰ΩøÁî®‰∏çÂêåÁöÑ$\phi$ÂØπbaselineÁΩëÁªúËøõË°åÊâ©Â±ïÔºåÂæóÂà∞‰∫ÜEfficientNet-B1Âà∞B7 ÁªìÊûú ÂØπMobileNetÂíåResNetÈááÁî®ËøôÁßçÊñπÊ≥ïËøõË°åÁΩëÁªúÊâ©Â±ï Âú®ImageNet‰∏äÁöÑÊ®°ÂûãÂèÇÊï∞Èáè‰∏éÁ≤æÂ∫¶ÂØπÊØîÂõæ Âú®ÂÖ∂ÂÆÉÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ‰∏äËøÅÁßªÂ≠¶‰π†ÁöÑÊïàÊûúÔºåÂú®5‰∏™Êï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ‰∏äËææÂà∞‰∫ÜSOTAÔºåÂèÇÊï∞Âπ≥ÂùáÂáèÂ∞ë9.6ÂÄç„ÄÇ ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂá∫Â§çÂêàÁº©ÊîæÊñπÊ≥ïÊØî‰ªª‰ΩïÂçï‰∏ÄÊïàÊûúÈÉΩÂ•Ω EfficientDet: Scalable and Efficient Object Detection‰ª£Á†Å EfficientDet-D7 ÔºöÂú® 326B FLOPSÔºåÂèÇÊï∞Èáè 52 MÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºåCOCO 2017 validation Êï∞ÊçÆÈõÜ‰∏äÂèñÂæó‰∫Ü 51.0 ÁöÑ mAPÔºåstate-of-the-art ÁöÑÁªìÊûú„ÄÇÂíå AmoebaNet + NAS-FPN Áõ∏ÊØîÔºåFLOPS ‰ªÖ‰∏∫ÂÖ∂ÂçÅÂàÜ‰πã‰∏ÄÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÂèñÂæó‰∫ÜÊõ¥Â•ΩÁöÑÁªìÊûú Êú¨ÊñáÈ¶ñÂÖàÊèêÂá∫‰∫Ü‰∏§‰∏™ÊåëÊàòÔºö efficient multi-scale feature fusion .‰πãÂâçÁöÑÂ§öÂ∞∫Â∫¶ÁâπÂæÅËûçÂêàÊñπÂºèFPN„ÄÅPANet„ÄÅNAS_FPNÁ≠âÔºåÂú®ËûçÂêà‰∏çÂêåÁöÑËæìÂÖ•ÁâπÂæÅÊó∂ÔºåÂè™ÊòØ‰∏çÂä†Âå∫ÂàÜÂú∞ÁÆÄÂçïÁõ∏Âä†„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØÔºåÁî±‰∫éËøô‰∫õ‰∏çÂêåËæìÂÖ•ÁâπÂæÅÁöÑÂàÜËæ®Áéá‰∏çÂêåÔºåÈÄöÂ∏∏ÂÆÉ‰ª¨ÂØπËûçÂêàÂêéÁöÑËæìÂá∫ÁâπÂæÅÁöÑË¥°ÁåÆ‰∏çÂπ∂Áõ∏Âêå„ÄÇ‰∏∫‰∫ÜËß£ÂÜ≥Ëøô‰∏™ÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÊú¨ÊñáÊèêÂá∫ÂèåÂêëÂä†ÊùÉÁâπÂæÅÈáëÂ≠óÂ°îÁΩëÁªúÔºàweighted bi-directional feature pyramid network (BiFPN) ÔºâÔºåÂÆÉ‰ΩøÁî®‰∫ÜÂèØÂ≠¶‰π†ÁöÑÊùÉÈáçÔºåÊù•Â≠¶‰π†‰∏çÂêåËæìÂÖ•ÁâπÂæÅÁöÑË¥°ÁåÆÔºåÂπ∂ÈáçÂ§çÂ∫îÁî®Âú®Ëá™‰∏äËÄå‰∏ãÂíåËá™‰∏ãËÄå‰∏äÁöÑÂ§öÂ∞∫Â∫¶ÁâπÂæÅËûçÂêà‰∏≠„ÄÇ model scaling. ÂÄüÂä©‰πãÂâçÊèêÂá∫ÁöÑEfficientNetÁΩëÁªúÔºåÊèêÂá∫‰∫ÜÂ∫îÁî®Âú®ÁõÆÊ†áÊ£ÄÊµãÈ¢ÜÂüüÁöÑcompound scaling method„ÄÇÂ∞ÜEfficientNetÁöÑ‰∏ªÂπ≤ÁΩëÁªú‰∏éBiFPNÁªìÂêàÔºåÊèêÂá∫‰∫ÜÊñ∞ÁöÑÁõÆÊ†áÊ£ÄÊµãÁΩëÁªúÔºåEfficientDetÔºåÂêåÊó∂Âú®ËØ≠‰πâÂàÜÂâ≤È¢ÜÂüü‰πüÂèñÂæó‰∫ÜÊõ¥Â•ΩÁöÑÊïàÊûú„ÄÇ BiFPN FPN: NAS-FPN : ‰ΩøÁî®neural architecture searchÊù•ÊêúÁ¥¢Êõ¥Â•ΩÁöÑË∑®Â∞∫Â∫¶ÁâπÂæÅÁΩëÁªúÊãìÊâëÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂú®ÊêúÁ¥¢ËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠ÈúÄË¶ÅÊï∞ÂçÉ‰∏™GPUÂ∞èÊó∂ÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÁΩëÁªúÊòØ‰∏çËßÑÂàôÁöÑÔºåÈöæ‰ª•Ëß£ÈáäÊàñ‰øÆÊîπ„ÄÇ PANet: Âú®FPNÂü∫Á°Ä‰∏äÂ¢ûÂä†‰∫ÜÈ¢ùÂ§ñÁöÑËá™‰∏ãËÄå‰∏äÁöÑÁΩëÁªúËûçÂêàË∑ØÂæÑ„ÄÇ ‰∏âÁßçÊñπÂºè‰∏≠ÔºåPANetÁ≤æÂ∫¶ÊúÄÈ´òÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂèÇÊï∞ÂíåËÆ°ÁÆóÈáèÊúÄÂ§ö„ÄÇ Êú¨ÊñáÊèêÂá∫ÁöÑ‰ºòÂåñÊñπÊ≥ïÔºö Âà†Èô§Âè™Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ËæìÂÖ•ËæπÁöÑËäÇÁÇπ„ÄÇÁêÜÁî±ÊòØÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÁõÆÁöÑÊòØËûçÂêà‰∏çÂêåÁâπÂæÅÔºåËÄåÂè™Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ËæìÂÖ•ÁöÑËäÇÁÇπÊ≤°ÊúâËøõË°åÁâπÂæÅËûçÂêàÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§ÂÆÉÁöÑË¥°ÁåÆËæÉÂ∞è„ÄÇ Â¶ÇÊûúÂéüÂßãËæìÂÖ•ËäÇÁÇπÂíåËæìÂá∫ËäÇÁÇπÂú®Âêå‰∏ÄÂ±ÇÔºåÈÇ£‰πàÂ¢ûÂä†‰∏ÄÊù°È¢ùÂ§ñÁöÑËæπÔºå‰ª•‰æøÂú®‰∏çÂ¢ûÂä†ËøáÂ§öcostÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãËûçÂêàÊõ¥Â§öÁâπÂæÅ„ÄÇ ÂíåPANetÂè™Êúâ‰∏ÄÊù°top-downÂíåbottom-upË∑ØÂæÑ‰∏çÂêåÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÊØè‰∏ÄÊù°ÂèåÂêëË∑ØÂæÑËßÜ‰∏∫‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁâπÂæÅÁΩëÁªúÂ±ÇÔºåÂπ∂ÈÄöËøáÂ∞ÜËøô‰∏™Â±ÇÈáçÂ§çÂ§öÊ¨°Êù•ÂÆûÁé∞Êõ¥È´òÁ∫ßÂà´ÁöÑÁâπÂæÅËûçÂêà„ÄÇ Weighted Feature Fusion‰∏∫‰∫ÜËß£ÂÜ≥‰∏çÂêåÂ±ÇÁâπÂæÅË¥°ÁåÆ‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÔºåÂØπ‰∫éÊØè‰∏Ä‰∏™ËæìÂÖ•ÈÉΩÂ¢ûÂä†‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊùÉÈáçÔºåËÆ©ÁΩëÁªúÂéªÂ≠¶‰π†‰∏çÂêåËæìÂÖ•ÁâπÂæÅÁöÑÈáçË¶ÅÊÄß„ÄÇÂü∫‰∫éËøô‰∏™ÊÉ≥Ê≥ïÔºåÊèêÂá∫‰∫Ü‰∏âÁßçÂä†ÊùÉÁâπÂæÅËûçÂêàÊñπÂºèÔºö Unbounded fusion Ôºö$O=\sum_iw_i.I_i$Ôºå$w_i$ÊòØÂèØÂ≠¶‰π†ÁöÑÊùÉÈáçÔºåÂΩ¢ÂºèÂèØ‰ª•ÊòØscalar(pre-feature)Ôºåvector(per-channel)Ôºåmulti-dimensional tensor(per-pixel)ÔºåscalarÂèØ‰ª•ÂèñÂæóÂíåÂÖ∂‰ªñÊñπÊ≥ïÁõ∏ËøëÁöÑÁ≤æÂ∫¶ÔºåÂπ∂ÊúâÁùÄÊúÄÂ∞èÁöÑcostÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØscalar weight is unboundedÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ÂèØËÉΩÂØºËá¥ËÆ≠ÁªÉ‰∏çÁ®≥ÂÆöÔºåÂõ†Ê≠§Ôºå‰ΩøÁî®weight normalizationÊù•ÈôêÂÆöweightÂèñÂÄºËåÉÂõ¥ Softmax-based fusionÔºö$O=\sum_i\frac{e^{w_i}}{\sum_je^{w_j}}¬∑I_i$ÔºåÁõ¥ËßÇÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ïÊòØÂ∫îÁî®SoftmaxÔºåÂ∞ÜÊâÄÊúâÊùÉÈáçÂΩí‰∏ÄÂåñÂà∞0~1ÔºåË°®Á§∫ÂÖ∂ÈáçË¶ÅÊÄß„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊ†πÊçÆÊ∂àËûçÂàÜÊûêÔºåÈ¢ùÂ§ñÁöÑSoftmax‰ºöÂØºËá¥GPUÂáèÈÄü„ÄÇ Fast normalization fusionÔºö$O=\sum_i\frac{w_i}{\epsilon+\sum_jw_j}¬∑I_i$ÔºåÈÄöËøáÂú®ÊØè‰∏™$w_i$ÂêéÂä†ReluÂ±ÇÊù•‰øùËØÅ$w_i\geq0$ÔºåÂêåÊó∂$\epsilon=0.0001$Êù•ÈÅøÂÖçÊï∞ÂÄº‰∏çÁ®≥ÂÆö„ÄÇËøôÊ†∑ÂÄº‰πü‰ºöÂΩí‰∏ÄÂåñÔºå‰ΩÜÂõ†‰∏∫Ê≤°ÊúâSoftmaxÂ±Ç‰ºöÊõ¥Âä†È´òÊïà„ÄÇÈÄöËøáÊ∂àËûçÂàÜÊûêËØÅÊòéËøôÁßçÊñπÊ≥ïÂíåÂü∫‰∫éSoftmaxÁöÑÊñπÊ≥ïË°®Áé∞ÂíåÁ≤æÂ∫¶Áõ∏ÂΩìÔºå‰ΩÜÂú®GPU‰∏ä‰ºöÂø´30%„ÄÇ level6 for BiFPN shown in Figure 2(d)Ôºö EfficientDetEfficientDet Architecture Compound ScalingÂíåEfficientNet‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÊòØÔºåÂíåÂàÜÁ±ªÊ®°ÂûãÁõ∏ÊØîÁõÆÊ†áÊ£ÄÊµãÊúâÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑscaling dimensionsÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Âú®ÊâÄÊúâdimension‰∏äËøõË°ågrid search‰ª£‰ª∑ËøáÈ´ò„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§ÈááÁî®ÂêØÂèëÂºèscalingÊñπÊ≥ïÔºå‰ΩÜÊÄùÊÉ≥‰∏ä‰ªçÁÑ∂ÊòØËÅîÂêàÊîæÂ§ßÊâÄÊúâÁª¥Â∫¶„ÄÇ Backbone networkÔºöÂíåEfficientNet B0-B6‰ΩøÁî®Áõ∏ÂêåÁöÑÊîæÂ§ßÁ≥ªÊï∞„ÄÇ BiFPN networkÔºö Box/class prediction networkÔºöÂÆÉÁöÑÂÆΩÂ∫¶ÂíåBiFPN‰øùÊåÅ‰∏ÄËá¥Ôºà$W_{pred}=W_{bifpn}$Ôºâ,Ê∑±Â∫¶Á∫øÊÄßÂ¢ûÂä†Ôºö$D_{box}=D_{class}=3+\left \lfloor \phi/3 \right \rfloor$ Input image resolutionÔºöÂõ†‰∏∫BiFPN‰ΩøÁî®‰∫Ü3-7Â±ÇÁöÑÁâπÂæÅÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ËæìÂÖ•ÁöÑÂàÜËæ®ÁéáÈúÄË¶ÅËÉΩË¢´$2^7=128$Êï¥Èô§Ôºö$R_{input}=512+\phi¬∑128$Ôºå Âü∫‰∫é‰ª•‰∏ä‰∏â‰∏™ÂÖ¨ÂºèÔºåÊãìÂ±ïÂºÄÂèë‰∫ÜEfficientDet D0-D7„ÄÇ Ablation StudyDisentangling Backbone and BiFPN BiFPN CrossScale Connections Softmax vs Fast Normalized Fusion Compound Scaling
